Hello,  
  
I am trading since the year of 2000. I do use different strategies and styles, but some years ago I fall in love with grid trading. Yes, I – and hopefully you – know, it is high risk, and when you try like me to gain performance 100% + a year at some point you will always hit the doomsday drawdown and blow your account. Non or less, my heartbeat goes up when thinking of the grid and many nights I swapped my sleep for intense back testing.  
  
Some years ago, I found the EA “Super Money Grid” at the internet. I started testing it and after a while it went live with some real money. After 2 years I had many ideas how to optimize this strategy. A friend of mine is a coder and wanted to learn MQL 4. We teamed up, I explained him my ideas and he put them into the code. After 6 months we had a brand-new version of the EA with many cool features, we called it BlackMamba Ikarus.  
  
So if you wonder about the name, well, the story of Icarus was for me always the perfect picture one should keep in mind when using a grid style trading approach: You will fly, but do not go to high, because the sun will burn your wings and your account will crash down.  
  
**When using I highly recommend starting on a demo account, only use with real money when you can handle the EA and are aware of the extreme risks involved in this trading style.**  
  

Attached Image (click to enlarge)

[![Click to Enlarge

Name: 1.JPG
Size: 155 KB](/attachment/image/3907866/thumbnail?d=1617697812)](/attachment/image/3907866?d=1617697812)   

  
  
**Settings:**  
  
**

Attached Image

![](/attachment/image/3901549?d=1617021893)

**  
  
**m****agic** : Magic Number if you want to run EA on different instruments on in one account  
**grid_size** : Distance between the order of one cycle  
**gs_progession** : Factor to expand grid_size

  1. 0 = Disabled, all orders will have the same distance
  2. 1 = Distance between orders will grow 1/2/3/4/5… (D’Alembert)
  3. 2 = Distance between orders will grow 1/2/4/8/16…(Martingale)
  4. 3 = Distance between orders will grow 1/1/2/3/5…(Fibonacci)

**take_profit** : Setting for securing profit of the cycle with a trailing stop.  
**pro****fit_lock** : Percentage of profit secured by trailing stop.  
**min_lot** : Volume to start a new cycle.  
**equity_warning** : Drawdown alert, when active will stop auto opening of orders.  
**account_risk** : Stop Loss on account base, when reached all orders will be closed an EA will stop trading.  
**progression** : Setting for volume progression within one cycle.

  1. 0 = Disabled, all orders will have the same volume
  2. 1 = Volume will grow within a cycle 1/2/3/4/5 based on min_lot… (D’Alembert)
  3. 2 = Volume will grow within a cycle 1/2/4/8/16 based on min_lot …(Martingale)
  4. 3 = Volume will grow within a cycle 1/1/2/3/5 based on min_lot …(Fibonacci)

**max_possitions** : Setting for maximal positions per cycle.  
**unbalance_control** : Hedging function

  1. A new cycle (e.g. buy) will be opened with the 3. Last volume of the unclosed cycle (e.g. sell).
  2. This will cause EXTREME RISK and can blow your account easily.

**max_spread** : Setting to avoid big [spreads](/brokers/spreads "View Live Spreads on the Broker Guide") when opening positions. Enter MT4 points here, 1 pip = 10.  
**show_forecast** : Enables graphic elements in the chart.  
  
**How it will trade:**  
  
The EA is working on FX Pairs, I personally trade it on majors (EURUSD, USDCHF, GBPUSD % USDJPY) and bigger minors (e.g.EURGBP or EURJPY). All orders will be executed as market order, the trailing stop is handled by the EA. Therefore I highly recommend running it on MT4 hosted on a remote server.  
  
**Timeframe is not relevant because this version is using no indicators.**  
  
When started the EA will open immediately two cycles with one buy and one sell order. If the market goes north, the buy cycle will be locked with a trailing stop while the sell cycle will open the next order to average the sell cycle price. As soon as the trailing stop is hit and a cycle is closed in profits, a new cycle will be started. The EA is including commissions and swaps in the take profit calculation.  
  
Take profit and the next price where orders will be added are shown in the chart as indication. On the right side of the chart, you have an info panel giving you an overview on spread, account and both cycles. On the left side of the chart, you will see information on both cycles and your settings. You can hide this information and the button when clicking “Show/Hide Comments”.  
  
The EA has some hot buttons so you can manage the action with one click:

  1. **Stop Next Cycle** : After a cycle is closed in profit the new cycle will not be started.
  2. **Rest & Realize**: The EA will not add any new positions, when the take profit is reached it will use the trailing stop to secure and realize the cycle profit
  3. **Stop & Close**: All positions will be closed immediately, and the EA will not open new cycles

  
When a cycle has reached the number of positions you set in max_possition the manual mode hot buttons will be activated (Buttons will show yellow colour, Yellow Alert). The modus is also activated when equity drawdown is higher than the setting under equity_warning (Buttons will show red colour, Red Alert).  
  

Attached Image (click to enlarge)

[![Click to Enlarge

Name: 2.JPG
Size: 153 KB](/attachment/image/3907864/thumbnail?d=1617697735)](/attachment/image/3907864?d=1617697735)   

  
  
Hot buttons while in Alter Yellow or Red:

  1. **Buy / Sell** : Open manual the next order, volume will be based on EA setting
  2. **Cl. Last B / Cl. Last S** : The last order of the cycle will be closed.
  3. **Cl. All Bs / Cl. All Ss** : Close all order of a cycle

  
When the EA is in Alarm Yellow or Red, it will **not** automatically open new position to the cycle which is in drawdown, but will close a cycle with the trailing stop function when take profit is reached.

  1. During alert modus max. equity and current drawdown will be shown on the left side of your screen.
  2. During alert modus a line indicates, where the new take profit will be, when a position is manual added when using the Buy / Sell button.
  3. During alert modus a line in the chart indicates where the account will hit margin call.

  
I am trading with the EA on a live account (1:200). I consider this to be a “fun” account, so it is much smaller than my regular accounts. Therefore, I try to push hard and this year was quite good so far. On the account I am using a beta version of Ikarus which I unfortunately cannot post here, main difference is the opening of a cycle will be done on an indicator base, the rest of the cycle is handled the same way than the EA you can download here. For entries I am using a combination of BollingerBands and Stochastik or RSI indicator.  
  
I have many ideas how to improve the EA further, unfortunately my old coder is to busy nowadays, and I am not a coder but a trader. So, if someone is interested and blessed with MQL4 skills, I would be more than happy to use this thread for improving this EA together with you.  
  
**CODERS, PLease check post 213 for my current ideas to improve Icarus, your support is highly appreciated!**

The original code is written in pre-"build 600" style which allows a number of coding issues to go unchecked, so attempting to compile in "strict" mode resulted in 130 warnings and several errors. In addition, NormalizeDouble() was being used where DoubleToString() was required, and vise versa. There were also bugs in the array access code and variable scoping issues which required fixing.  
  
The attached version compiles without error and a EURUSD back-test from 01/01/2020-24/03/2021 matched exactly with the back-test of the original code, so it seems there are no issues with the code clean-up.  
  
Initial observations suggest an issue with the profit trailing approach (or perhaps the code) as a previous test left the trailing stop level hundreds of pips from market price.

> Can you explain the unbalance control function? It is assumed that at a specific moment, the previous cycle closes and another opposite begins with the lot of the last closed order ?. How is it configured? a specific number? In backtesting it doesn't work for me.
> 
> Ignored

Hi, yes off course, here you go.  
  
First, the unbalance mode in the current version is VERY dangerous, it will almost guarantee to blow up your account. Therefore, I advise you not to use it with real money. Having that said this mode is still a valid option for the version of the EA, I would like to develop in this thread, on my current beta version of the EA I sometimes use it when bigger drawdown is kicking in.  
  
So how does the mode work? You are activating it with the input “1”. In doing so you are giving the EA instructions to link the starting volume of the closed cycle to the 3. Last traded volume of the open cycle (which will have a negative PL at this moment).  
  
Example:  
Let’s say you are trading with progression = 3 (Fibonacci). The EA has opened 4 Buy order so far (0,01/0,01/0,02/0,03) and now the sell cycle is closed in profit. The new sell cycle will open with 0,01 lot, because this is the third last volume of the open buy cycle.  
  
We are still trading with progression 3, but now the EA has opened 5 buy orders (0,01/0,01/0,02/0,03/0,05). The sell cycle is closed and will be opened now with 0,02 instead of 0,01, due to the reason this is the 3. Last volume of the buy cycle.  
  
This is how the modus works, so when it comes to a trend you will have bigger volume = potential wins against the direction where your drawdown is. Since the EA is opening ongoing cycles, this will lead to a ping pong effect which will drastically add volume to the starting order of each cycle. I have some ideas for this feature for our improved version which I will tell you soon so we can discuss it.  
  
Cheers

Welcome flashpaul,  
  
as stated befor I do not have experience in using Icarus on non FX instruments. But yes, you nailed it, optimum market is a volatile phase, it can be up or down or range, but enought volatility so both cycles can be closed. **By the way, with a high setting on profit_lock the EA will trade more risky than with a low setting**. Reason behind: The new cycle will open closer to the high or low of the movement and will potential add more trades when the market changes direction. This is on of the reasons I want to have a indicator based entry (like my beta) so we can also use higher profit lock due to the fact the new cycle will not open imidiatly after the old one was closed...  
  
So as outlook for the EA I would like to create with the help of this wonderful forum, I give you some inside on the Beta of the EA which I use on my real account:

  1. Opens cycle on conditions from BollingerBands and or Stoachastik / RSI, from second order it behaves like Ikarus 2.0. Currently my cycle opens when high/low crosses 3 Std. Dev. on BB(20) and Slow Stochastik ist higher/lower 30/70. All on m5 chart.
  2. Has an option to stop trading on a daily target (I do not use this)
  3. Has a automatic and manual "trendfunction" (I do not use it).

Thank you for your question,  
  
Cheers

The "right" settings depend on many things like risk appetite, leverage, account type and account size. Out of my experience I would advise you do some backtest. When you find settings you like, make a visual BT and ask yourself if you are happy with trading frequency and equity drawdown. Then use an demo account for a front test of your settings...After that decide if you want start with real money.  
  
I know people's first guess us EA means starting trading easily and saving time. Out of my experience this is not true. Yes, you save time on trading, but you have to invest time in testing.

The role of ATR as a normal method is to set the loss cut position.  
Since the lot size is determined from the amount of funds for the loss cut position, the normal method cannot be used.  
A possible method is to multiply the long ATR value by a certain coefficient.  
You have to look for that factor with careful testing. To increase the lot of hedge positions like martingale.  
  
Alternatively, the total lot size for the amount of funds can be calculated from the loss cut position used in this logic and subtracted.

Sure thing that a lower lot size would reduce the DD. But as you see in my post that you quoted I mention that these tests were made with the same risk as in MaPi's original settings, meaning 0.01 lots on a $1000 account. Hello MaPi,  
and many thanks for sharing freely this awesome EA. This is my first introduction to the grid trading concept and using the conservative settings recommended on EU, and UJ and watching how the EA worked was enlightening and profitable!  
  
I am also surprised no one has mentioned using the "Rest & Realize Button". After you have an a imbalance in your Buys or Sells, where one side is larger than the other and in Profit, if it looks like it's going to continue in that direction, press the Rest & Realize button. The EA will protect your profit and continue to increase as the trade continues in the swing, using a trailing stop to lock in profits! Now you can forget about that currency, & look for a good opportunity to enter on another one.  
One request or thing to add that I think would be useful is if a Button could be added so that a Trader can add a manual trade if they wanted & the EA would incorporate it into it's logic. I think this EA can be used as a great tool for a Trader if used wisely.  
  
To everyone asking questions about how the EA works, instead of back testing it, run it live on Demo on 1m or 5m, and watch it work for one whole trading session. You will gain a very good understanding of just how neat this EA works and ways you can use it as a tool to improve your trading.  
  
Thank you again MaPi. ![](https://resources.faireconomy.media/images/emojis/64/1f44d.png?v=15.1)

Hey friends,  
  
I hope you are doing fine. As promised, I will give you my ideas for the improvements of the EA. I told you I am trading on a beta with the possibility of opening buy/sell cycles with indicators. This version seems to me much more stable and safer than letting the EA open ongoing cycles once they have been closed.  
So, for the first new version I would update the EA with you together to the version I am using on my account plus some features which I expect to be a great help in trading the grid.  
  
I will update post 1 with Icarus 2.2 which was cleaned up by **fxtrue** and **fx1079** (thanks again for your work), I only will change back the name of the settings to the original ones I referred in post 1 so there will be no confusion. So, all improvement should be done with Ikarus2.2 as source.  
  
Let me start with an overview on possible changes, I will post them again one by one with more details so everybody can quote the relevant writing when needed.

  1. First order of a cycle can be triggered by Bollinger Bands, Stochastic and/or RSI
  2. Manual mode where all orders can be opened via hot buttons.
  3. Additional Function Grid Size can be calculated by ATR.
  4. Unbalanced mode can be combined with indicator cycle start.

  
We do have some request on trading with and against the trend and operating times for the EA, CoG and Daily target, but personal I think we can discuss those later after we made the first improvements.

  1. Use_Indicators: false / true
  2. Invert_Indicators: false / true (so e.g. with "false" it will be triggered when outside BB, with "true" it needs to be inside BBS)
  3. Use_BB: false / true
  4. BB_Period:
  5. BB_Deviation:
  6. BB_Shift:
  7. BB_Mode: 0 = bid/ask 1: High/Low (what is crossing BB)
  8. Use_Stoch: false / true
  9. Stoch_K:
  10. Stoch_D:
  11. Stoch_Slowing
  12. Stoch_Shift
  13. Stoch_Lower:
  14. Stoch_Upper:
  15. Use_RSI: false / true
  16. RSI_Period:
  17. RSI_Shift:
  18. RSI_Lower:
  19. RSI_Upper:

First, read up somewhere how labouchere works if you havent, and come back here.   
  
So to use Labouchere when no cycle ends in loss, you just have to redefine what is a loss. In this case, it cant be when we go minus, because as we know, it never does.  
  
Lets say that a loss is when a cycles profit is below a certain amount.  
  
For example, using the sequence of 1,2,3,4,6 (this should also be in your optimization inputs, and remember it does not need to be sequential):  
  
1+6, so Bought 7 lots  
  
Cycle ends with 0.3% in profit = and we decided that 0.3% **considered a loss, so** next cycle our sequence has become 1,2,3,4,6,**7.** We take 1st and last again(1+7) because its a "loss" , and so next cycle we trade **8** lots.  
  
  
Then, lets say next cycle we make 2.5% and that is considered a win, then we **take off** 1 and 7, which leaves us with 2,3,4,6, and trade the amount of the next two outer numbers (2+6 = 8 lots), for the next cycle. and so on.   
  
When there are no more numbers, we just start again, with the original numbers.  
  
  
Sorry for the sloppy explanation, cant review right now... had too much to type today...   
  
  
so in optimization input we should also have cycle profit levels for labouchere of course

At least for good enough return/dd ratio on the long term... Market changes regularly in a way that without loss control, the return/dd ratio will always be awful. And that means finding the best way for a given strategy to actually accept a loss when these major market changes happen ; it is a necessity, in my experience, not an option. Withdrawing amounts regularly wont change that the busted accounts losses, no matter the withdrawals, will always make a poor return/dd overall.  
  
But I prefer to give you, this team and your ea s hidden potential, the benefit of the doubt!

[falanca](https://www.forexfactory.com/falanca),  
  
I just modified Icarus 2.2 so that it can open the first order of a BUY/SELL cycle according to COG indicator.  
To use indicators, we have to decide what the time frame is, I set the default value of time frame to 0, which means using the current time frame. One can change the default to 5, 15, 60, 240. ..., to represent other time frame. If the default value is used, you have to run the EA on the right time frame you wish it to be.  
I try COG first because it is relative simple. When Ask < sql (Low green line) we enter the first BUY order of a BUY cycle; as Bid > sqh (high green line) we enter the first SELL order of a SELL cycle.  
  
To others indicators, I have to know whether they are applied all or separated. Also, I need to know the time frame preferred and under what conditions we are going put a first buy/sell order.

The EA uses CoG just via two boolean functions as fallows.  
  
bool CoG_Buy(int tf) {  
double cog_sql = iCustom(Symbol(), tf, "Center of Gravity.ex4", 2, 0);  
if (Ask < cog_sql) return( true );  
else return ( false );  
return (false);  
}  
bool CoG_Sell(int tf) {  
double cog_sqh = iCustom(Symbol(), tf, "Center of Gravity.ex4", 1, 0);  
if (Bid > cog_sqh) return( true );  
else return ( false );  
return (false);   
}  
  
As CoG_Buy() returns true, we buy. As CoG_Sell() returns true, we sell.

@falanca,  
  
If you use CoG together with Icarus, it is difficult to see both cycle exists. It is if a buy cycle (for instance) is initiated, there is definite no sell cycle until the CoG sell condition is reached. However, when the sell condition is finally reached, perhaps your buy orders are all closed due to end of profit. That is, it has to wait another buy signal from CoG to initialize another buy cycle. That is why you always see one way cycle.  
  
If you like to see two-way cycles both exist, maybe you should set the take profit larger than the CoG range. That will cause the buy cycle won't end of profit before a sell cycle is initiated.  
  
Or, if you want CoG just to open the very first cycle (buy/sell), after the first cycle is initiated, the EA will go back to normal working, that is, initiate an opposite cycle simultaneously and then any new buy/sell cycle won't according to CoG to be initiated, just as we run an original Icarus. If that is you want, I have to re-code the EA for you.  
  
Attached is use CoG only for the first time to initiate a first cycle.

Hello,  
  
On Mode candle high/low the EA would trigger also orders inside the bands, when e.g:  
  
A) within the same candle a second cycle is opened, the high is on/above bb but current price is within bb  
  
B) high is on/above bb, but other indicator e g. Stochastik is under 70, on same candle current price moves under BB (high is still above) and stochastic is 》70  
  
On Mode bid/ask there will be no trading within the bands  
  
Hope this was clear, if not I will make a graph!

Bollinger Band is a bad indi for a EA. When you go in trend BB give you always signal in counter trend.  
Better is to use a trend following and momentum indicators (Step Ehlers Optimal Tracking Filter and CoppocK curve: edit by MrTools or others).  
In the inversion pattern often you will have a contrary order. The EA should hedge with opposit orders this position and close it as soon as possibile (i.e. when reach a positiv equitya small loss).   
In the following exaple the EA in GU H1 need 4 months in 2018 before to close an open sells with a bad equity with a buy again open all without considering the cost of the swap or the possibility, if the losing position is closed beforehand, to make several other operations in the meantime.

I didn't change the Grip trading logic of ICarus, CoG indicator is only used to determine when to initiate a Grip trading cycle or cycles. I had uploaded two versions, Icarus_2.2_COG and Icarus_2.2_COG_once. The former will wait for CoG signal to initiate a new cycle, buy as well as sell. You are hardly to see both cycles exists when running the former. The later only use COG to initiate the very first cycle (buy or sell), then initiate another opposite cycle simultaneously. You can see both buy and sell orders are opened.  
  
If you see both buy and sell orders opened simultaneously and you were not running Icarus_2.2_COG_once, the only reason to explain is: You have a buy (for example) cycle, but no sell cycle. When the last buy order of the buy cycle reached its SL, instead of closed the order, Icarus will open another additional buy order with lots progressively. Also, just at this moment, CoG give a signal to initiate the sell cycle. If it is this case, you can check the lots of two opposite orders, they should different if your progressive value is not set to 0.  
  
It seems to me that you want to use CoG to determine an appropriate grip size, it also can be done but it is another story. You have to tell me how to calculate your grip size from distances between CoG lines.

Trailing stops result in no appreciable server load if correctly implemented - the only time there's a noticeable issue (which often results in brokers blocking the offending trading accounts) is when poorly coded trailing stop code sends modify requests for the same SL level. The issue is easy to spot as there are repeated warnings posted on the Experts and Journal tabs and easily prevented by ensuring the new SL level is higher than the previous level for buy orders / lower than the previous level for sell orders.

No, we don't need. Because Icarus or Ikarus doing trailing stop on the terminal end but server end. It won't send any modification to server to modify SL or TP of orders.  
  
When profit goal is reached, it begin the trailing stop process on the terminal end, it records maximum_profit has been reached. As the current profit lower profit_lock*maximum_profit, it will close all orders of the profitable cycle.  
  
Although, there are many OrderModify functions in the source code of Icarus, but they are not called by Icarus grid trading logic.

So at the end of the day, TIMING is important.  
EA can't decide when to enter. So EA has to be given rules to define what is good time to enter.  
Financial trading is random .  
Either your brain or EA has to decide on the timing of entry.  
Blind grids don't work in spot or futures.  
EA can help execute and manage trades.  
If EA has to decide on timing, then EA has to be fed with rules on how to locate such times.  
  
Blind grids work in directionless options selling which requires deep pockets.  
  
Unless you or EA is sure that retracement or pullback will happen during a certain time, then you can go for two ways of buying/selling or vice-versa.  
An estimate of retracement or pullback is important for giving grid trading a try.  
Only detailed probability studies focussing on locating good working times when retracements normally happen during a certain time can help.

OK. I try to briefly describe the program logic of Icarus as follows. We can only put codes at the RED NOTE part without changing the Grid trading logic of ICarus.  
  
A. Initial stage (Preparation), global variables settings and collect current Market information. (If we want decide grid size by indicators, we should modify here)  
B. Robot begins to run. (We can put codes here to decide whether or not to let the robot execute)  
When Robot is running, it will:  
Do account risk control firstly, then  
C. Deal with Buy orders  
C.1 If no buy order, open a buy order with minimum lots. (We can put codes here to decide when to open the first buy order of a Buy Cycle)  
C.2.1 If SL of the last buy order of Buy Cycle is reached, open another buy order lots increased according to progressive setting.  
C.2.2 If profits of total buy orders reached TP, begin profit lock control. Also update profit lock real time.  
C.2.3 If current profit falls below profit lock, close all buy orders of the Buy Cycle.  
D. Deal with Sell orders  
D.1 If no sell order, open a sell order with minimum lots. (We can put codes here to decide when to open the first sell order of a Sell Cycle)  
D.2.1 If SL of the last sell order of Sell Cycle is reached, open another sell order lots increased according to progressive setting.  
D.2.2 If profits of total sell orders reached TP, begin profit lock control. Also update profit lock real time.  
D.2.3 If current profit falls below profit lock, close all sell orders of the Sell Cycle.  
  
For example, I had added Time Restriction on B., to restrict Robot running time. Also, I put codes on C.1 and D.1, such that a buy or sell cycle will initiate according to CoG.  
  
Note that: the virtual SL and TP are calculated depended on grid size.  
  
Everyone could quote this post, such that we can understand what you want the EA to be.

at the moment Ikarus 2.0 (Post#1) can only do grid averaging down what many consider to be 'martingale' but in fact Ikarus 2.0 has other setting 1,2 and 3.  
these settings are very important when you want to average UP in the direction of the market.  
there are many things you need to know about the currency pairs market conditions when you want to trade with Averaging Down / Averaging UP.  
Ikarus 2.0 work best when market is sideways wide ranging and when the market breaks into a trending direction, this is where the manual cut-loss has to be by the trader. Question is which timeframe do you use to consider the market type conditions - Trending and Sideways?  
  
**gs_progession** : Factor to expand grid_size

  1. 0 = Disabled, all orders will have the same distance
  2. 1 = Distance between orders will grow 1/2/3/4/5… (D’Alembert)
  3. 2 = Distance between orders will grow 1/2/4/8/16…(Martingale)
  4. 3 = Distance between orders will grow 1/1/2/3/5…(Fibonacci)

**progression** : Setting for volume progression within one cycle.

  1. 0 = Disabled, all orders will have the same volume
  2. 1 = Volume will grow within a cycle 1/2/3/4/5 based on min_lot… (D’Alembert)
  3. 2 = Volume will grow within a cycle 1/2/4/8/16 based on min_lot …(Martingale)
  4. 3 = Volume will grow within a cycle 1/1/2/3/5 based on min_lot …(Fibonacci)

Example given, BB_Period=20, BB_Dev=3, Use_Stoch= true, Stoch_K=14, Stoch_D=5, Stoch_Slow=3  
The indicator condition is only opening the first order, the following orders of the cycle will be handled by pure grid logic.  
For BB I would love to have to options:  
1) {C}High/Low: This means a candle must touch the BB or trade outside of the BB. The opening of the first order can be within the bands (e.g. because stochastic is not > 70 when price touch BB, price comes back into the Band and Stochastic becomes on the same candle >70)  
2) {C}Bid/Ask: Here the cycle will only be opened when execution is on our outside BB. For sells bid must be >= UpperBand, for buys ask must be <= LowerBand  
Invert Indicators would mean with those settings, a cycle will be opend when price is within 3 Dev of BB and with 30 / 70 of stochastic.  
Conjunct_Idx we do not need, because you can enable and disable ever indicator via “Use_” setting, or did I miss here something?  
Timeframe should be the current time frame of the chart.

ATR should be calculated on the begin of a new cycle only, so we do not run the risk, ATR and therefore grid size will get smaller after a cycle is opened.

Unbalanced_controll should work with indicator open (just mention this because my old coder was not able to do so, the use of this function was disabling indicator opening).

To my understanding, I confirm what your requirements are in other words.  
  
The indicator condition is only opening the first order, the following orders of the cycle will be handled by pure grid logic.  
  
You are going to use indicator condition to initiate all buy and sell cycles. Not just to initiate the first buy or sell cycle.  
  
For BB I would love to have to options:  
1) {C}High/Low: This means a candle must touch the BB or trade outside of the BB. The opening of the first order can be within the bands (e.g. because stochastic is not > 70 when price touch BB, price comes back into the Band and Stochastic becomes on the same candle >70)  
2) {C}Bid/Ask: Here the cycle will only be opened when execution is on our outside BB. For sells bid must be >= UpperBand, for buys ask must be <= LowerBand  
  
1) {C}High/Low: As High > BB Upper Band and Stochastic > 70, initiate a sell cycle. As Low < BB Lower Band and Stochastic < 30, Initiate a buy cycle.  
2) {C}Bid/Ask: As Bid >= BB Upper Band, initiate a sell cycle. As Ask <= BB Lower Band, initiate a buy cycle.  
Option High/Low will use BB and Stochastic together and could initiate a cycle within BB.  
Option Bid/Ask takes only BB into consideration and no mention of Stochastic. It only initiate a cycle outside BB.  
  
Invert Indicators would mean with those settings, a cycle will be opend when price is within 3 Dev of BB and with 30 / 70 of stochastic.  
  
Does it mean (As Bid within BB and Stochastic > 70, initiate a sell cycle. As Ask within BB and Stochastic < 30, initiate a buy cycle.)?   
It seems to me that only Stochastic is used and Ask isn't larger than BB Upper Band as well as Bid isn't smaller than BB Lower Band. An invert option of Option Bid/Ask?

> Quote

> Here, I feel like this system is a regular grid strategy (I might be wrong, can someone indicate what are the specificities here?). 

  
No, it is not a regular grid strategy. I prefer to call its strategy a semi-grid strategy. There are two kinds of grid trading strategy, With-the-trend and Against-the-trend, the former takes advantages of trend, the later takes advantages of ranging. Regular grid strategy will put pending orders at the price of grid lines in advance. Instead of putting pending orders, this EA (Ikarus) beginning with a minimum lots of hedging orders and then send market orders when grid condition is triggered. Anyway, it stills a kind of Against-the-trend strategy. (To make the EA more profitable, perhaps we should initiate with a very small lots, 0.01 for example, and the second order should be with larger lots, 0.1 for example, to begin the regular grid trading process. But unfortunately, it has no such settings for us to set the lots of 1st and 2nd orders separately.)  
Owing to the fact that its strategy is a kind of Against-the-trend, it hates mono trend situations. When the market goes in a monotonic trend, the EA will cause you loss a lot of money, even, will definitely blow your account away if you set a larger initial lots.

What are you guys...

  
Good idea, but switching grid trading to zone recovery trading is not easy and switching it back to Grid trading is much more difficult. That will be much more easy to switch an Against-the-trend to a With-the-trend grid trading. Knowing that you just need changing the buy order to sell order and vice versa when triggered from a Against-the-trend Grid trading, the grid trading strategy will become to a With-the-trend. The purpose of zone recovery trading is to recover the loss when we have a wrong judgement of the trend. Zone recovery hates ranging. Trending with zone recovery is OK but ranging. If we already know the market is in trending not ranging, we don't need zone recovery.  
  
The question is, when should we switch grid trading to With-the-trend and when should we switch it back? We need an indicator to detect trending or ranging. Any suggestion of such indicator?

We could estimate those two delays with extensive backtesting with **varying EA parameters** I guess. For example, we can fix an initial capital (e.g. $1,000) and follow this protocol:

  1. For each day in the past, get the amount of time it takes to get to $2,000, and let the test run through until the account blows up as well. In case of blowing-up happening **before** recovery, we can note this time-to-blow-up value, then run the backtest again from after the blow-up to estimate some sort of "time it would have took to recovery if blowing-up conditions did not occur".
  2. You then have a list of T(blow-up) and T(double-up) for each day, which you can infer statistics on. The idea is that, if you have settings such that **E**(time to blow-up) >> **E**(time to recovery), you can certainly survive with profits on the market.
  3. Also, these random variables heavily rely on market conditions, see attached screenshot of EURUSD from Jan 2020 to now. The early 2020 crisis was a very special market condition of massive up then down trend where every agains-the-trend strategy would have failed.

> 
> Disliked
> 
> The question is, when should we switch grid trading to With-the-trend and when should we switch it back? We need an indicator to detect trending or ranging. Any suggestion of such indicator?
> 
> Ignored

This is where it gets hard. In my opinion, we should not rely on superstitious indicators and weird astrological stuff to get there. Instead, let's consider two basic indicators: volume and simple MA. My guess is that, when the market is ranging, the price tends to revolve around its SMA and this SMA remains "flat" (we can determine the derivative of the SMA for example, if it stays around an interval centered around 0, then it's mostly flat). When the market starts to trend, the price start deviating from its SMA, but to confirm the trend, we can have a look at the derivative (and maybe the second derivative as some sort of inertia indicator as well) of the SMA. Also, there is usually spikes in volume when it comes to trending phases. All in all, I think that a mix of volume analysis and SMA (with dSMA/dt and d2SMA/dt2) analysis can help us here. Let's keep in mind that there is no way of actually predicting these phases 100% of the time; but a slight edge on this can allow us to extend the EA's life enough so we can cash-out regularly and stay profitable.  
  
  
Speaking of cashing out regularly, my guess is that @MaPi's method is definitely the right one: he combines cashing-out regularly to increase its profit and have as less cash exposed on risk as possible, but he doesn't cash-out the same amount each time and lets his account grow: this helps him have a more and more robust account in case of drawdown. So yeah, Fibonacci might be on our side with this one.  
  
Also, external news are also to be considered. Back to the attached screenshot, the early-2020 situation was something we were aware of; we can manually disable the EA during these times maybe?  
  
**Final thought** : if @MaPi is okay with this, maybe we can create some sort of Discord to make communication easier on this matter? What are you guys thoughts? I am actually convinced that such a system can work out in the long-term!  
  
Cheers.

I run back test on MT4, it will open positions. I am not using VPS yet, you know, I just a newbie to Forex trading. No positions opened means the trigger condition is not reached, the EA should work indifferently whether or not VPS is used.  
If you run it in a real time mode not a back test, you have to aware that if indicators is used it won't open positions right away, because the trigger condition is not reached.  
Sometimes on my back test, for some indicator condition I set, it open no positions in a week. Especially, when you use BB 3.0, and a whole week the price never break through BB 3.0 Upper or Lower levels, then no position will be open. If is that case, try to set Deviation of BB to 2.0 or 1.0. Or, other way, you can use same settings testing on your PC not VPS.  
To me, I didn't run many times testing of this EA. I only test it using MaPi trigger once, I found that when using MaPi trigger the positions it opened are far fewer than not using. If I like to test some indicator myself, I will write the code directly, no need to through a cocktail indicators option like this.  
You should tell me your settings so that I can check and find out what the problem is.

[quote = FX6588;13504192]{quote}Hello my friend, I am using your default settings and no parameters have been set. I am looking at the code so that I can better understand the internal parameters and principles. Thank you for your reply and answer. I am glad to meet you![/ quote]  
My default is what MaPi suggested. You should set indicators use the settings you usually used. The logic is very simple, BB will trigger a buy cycle, when the price reach the Lower level of BB 3.0, a sell cycle when reach Upper level of BB 3.0. As I mentioned before, BB 3.0 is a very strait condition for opening an position.  
The probability of above or below the Upper or Lower levels of BB 3.0 is only 0.1%. While using Stochastic or RSI only, trigger conditions are much more easy to reach, because the default setting of Upper/ Lower level is 30/70.  
BB 3.0 brings you only 1/1000 chance to open a position. However, maybe it not a good thing if the position is opened. You have a relative large probability in a trending market, and as I have mentioned before, Icarus hates trending.

The purpose of this thread, I think, is to modify Icarus such it can be used more flexibly.  
  
To better understanding of how to flexibly use Icarus, we have to realize its behavior in advance.  
When Icarus start, with a hedging pair of a buy order and a sell order simultaneously, it initiates a buy cycle and a sell cycle.  
The grid trading logic of Icarus is a kind of Against-the-trend. There are only two cases, a new order will be opened by Icarus.  
Case 1: A cycle is closed in profit, a new cycle will be initiated immediately. That is, a new order is opened to be the first order of the new cycle.  
Case 2: A new order will be opened if the last order of a cycle is reached its SL. That is, a new order is added in this cycle.  
Case 1 and Case 2 forms the grid trading logic of Icarus.  
  
Without changing the grid trading logic of Icarus, the only thing we can do is to find a better timing to initiate a new cycle. Hence, we use indicators helping us to decide when to open the first order of a cycle. That is we now already have.  
  
The following discussing maybe somewhat off the topic of this thread. No mater how good a timing for Icarus to initiate a new cycle, it cannot prevent Icarus from breaking down when in a trending market. If we want to improve this, we have to change the trading logic of Icarus to a grid trading logic that can switch between With-trend and Against-trend dynamically, and if so, the EA will not be Icarus any more. I am trying to work out now. But it seems off the topic of this thread.

[quote = TeChaoLiang; 13508085]我认为，此线程的目的是修改Icarus，以便可以更灵活地使用它。为了更好地了解如何灵活使用Icarus，我们必须提前意识到其行为。当伊卡洛斯（Icarus）启动时，同时对冲买入订单和卖出订单时，它将启动买入周期和卖出周期。伊卡洛斯（Icarus）的网格交易逻辑是一种“逆潮流”。只有两种情况，伊卡洛斯将开立新订单。情况1：一个以盈利为目的的周期被关闭，一个新的周期将立即启动。即，新订单被打开为新周期的第一订单。情况2：如果达到了循环的最后一个订单，则将打开一个新订单。也就是说，在此循环中添加了新订单。案例1和案例2构成了Icarus的网格交易逻辑。在不更改Icarus的网格交易逻辑的情况下，我们唯一能做的就是找到更好的时机来启动新周期。因此，我们使用指标来帮助我们决定何时打开一个周期的第一个订单。那就是我们现在已经拥有的。以下讨论可能与该主题无关。无论伊卡洛斯启动新周期的时机多么好，它都无法阻止伊卡洛斯在市场趋势中崩溃。如果要改善此问题，我们必须将Icarus的交易逻辑更改为可以在动态趋势和逆趋势之间动态切换的网格交易逻辑，如果是这样，则EA不再是Icarus。我现在正在努力锻炼。但这似乎与该主题无关。[/ quote] 我们使用指标来帮助我们决定何时打开一个周期的第一个订单。那就是我们现在已经拥有的。以下讨论可能与该主题无关。无论伊卡洛斯启动新周期的时机多么好，它都无法阻止伊卡洛斯在市场趋势中崩溃。如果要改善此问题，我们必须将Icarus的交易逻辑更改为可以在动态趋势和逆趋势之间动态切换的网格交易逻辑，如果是这样，则EA不再是Icarus。我现在正在努力锻炼。但这似乎与该主题无关。[/ quote] 我们使用指标来帮助我们决定何时打开一个周期的第一个订单。那就是我们现在已经拥有的。以下讨论可能与该主题无关。无论伊卡洛斯启动新周期的时机多么好，它都无法阻止伊卡洛斯在市场趋势中崩溃。如果要改善此问题，我们必须将Icarus的交易逻辑更改为可以在动态趋势和逆趋势之间动态切换的网格交易逻辑，如果是这样，则EA不再是Icarus。我现在正在努力锻炼。但这似乎与该主题无关。[/ quote] 它无法阻止伊卡洛斯（Icarus）在趋势市场中崩溃。如果要改善此问题，我们必须将Icarus的交易逻辑更改为可以在动态趋势和逆趋势之间动态切换的网格交易逻辑，如果是这样，则EA不再是Icarus。我现在正在努力锻炼。但这似乎与该主题无关。[/ quote] 它无法阻止伊卡洛斯（Icarus）在趋势市场中崩溃。如果要改善此问题，我们必须将Icarus的交易逻辑更改为可以在动态趋势和逆趋势之间动态切换的网格交易逻辑，如果是这样，则EA不再是Icarus。我现在正在努力锻炼。但这似乎与该主题无关。[/ quote]

I think the unbalance control mode in Icarus is meaningless. However, because I am just a newbie to Forex trading, what I think it is meaningless may not be really meaningless.  
  
Icarus intend to handle unbalance by increasing the initial lots size when a cycle is closed and a new cycle initiated. The increased lots are used to hedge the loss of orders in another cycle to make a balance. It takes the lots of the last but three order in the opposite cycle as the initial lots of new cycle. (This is I mentioned before that the lots are not enough to control balance.) If the trend is continue moving to its direction, the increasing lots could recover the loss of the opposite cycle. The additional lots are just to be used for locking the loss when the market is changed from ranging to trending. However, when the market back to ranging, the addition lots could eventually become a killer of your account.

Our topic of this thread is "Free Grid EA Ikarus," but guys here should aware that Ikarus or Icarus is not a traditional Grid EA, and it had been modified by many peoples. After I have been traced the source codes of it, I would like to call it a semi-grid EA.  
  
A simple and traditional grid trading logic is we determine a grid size in advance, for example 20 pips, and a reference price for starting grid trading. If the current price is upper than the reference price plus 20 pips, we open a sell order, and at the same time, the reference price is changed to the current price. The TP and SL are no necessary to be depended on the grid size, your can set and modify them arbitrary if you are trading manually. Also, if the current price is lower than the reference price minus 20 pips, we open a buy order, the reference price is changed to the current price. This kind of grid trading logic is an Against-the-trend grid trading, sell at the higher grid line and buy at the lower grid line. This strategy will lock in profits as both buy and sell orders are triggered, but it requires a stop loss if the price moves in one direction. It favors a ranging market.  
  
When we switch the direction of buy and sell, the grid trading logic will buy at the higher grid line and sell at the lower grid line. The grid trading logic will become a with-the-trend grid trading. This strategy requires an exit when things are going well in order to lock in profits.  
  
You don't need any EA to do grid trading, you just need to put pending orders at the price of each grid line and set appropriate SL and TP.  
  
We can now compare Icarus to the traditional grid trading.  
  
1\. Icarus no a starting point (reference price), it put a pair of hedging orders to start the grid trading. That is, initiates a buy cycle and a sell cycle simultaneously. Using my modified version, we can use indicators to determine the timing of initiating each cycles and not starting with a pair hedging orders.  
2\. Icarus open a new order only on two situations. When a cycle close in profit then a new cycle is initiated, and, when a last order in its cycle reaches the virtual SL, a new order is add to the cycle. It does not open a new order when the last order in its cycle reaches the virtual TP. This is weird comparing to the traditional grid trading. Instead, when a last order of its cycle reaches the virtual TP, it only calculate the total profit of the cycle and performing the profit lock control. That's why I call the trading logic of Icarus a semi grid trading.  
3\. Icarus is a kind of Against-the-trend grid trading. It open buy order at the lower grid line and open sell order at the higher grid line when and only when the virtual SL is reached. Although it just a semi Against-the-trend grid trading, the SL control is still important. Because Icarus does not set a real SL together with the market orders it sends. There is no SL protection for your account and will eventually kill your account when in a trending market.  
4\. The profit lock control of Icarus is also weird. I would like call it a "profit loss control." Why? A real profit lock control is when we reach a certain amount of profit, we take some portion of the profit from the trade by closing order partially. However, Icarus do another way, it just set a percentage of max profit to protect the profit. When the total profit is less than the percentage of the max profit it ever reached, it close the cycle and take only the percentage of max profit. For example, if you set Profit_Lock to 0.3 you only receive 30 percent of the max profit the cycle ever reached. You loss 70 percent of max profit that you had the opportunity to earn. Because Icarus current version never send any order modification to trading server, it won't do any real profit lock control (take some profit out by close orders partially and leave the rest orders in the trade.) When you understand how Icarus doing the profit lock, you should know how to set Profit_Lock value to gain more profit.  
5\. Icarus never put any pending orders as traditional grid trading does, it only put market orders. Perhaps, the very beginning version of Icarus, before it becoming Ikarus or Icarus, the EA will put pending orders. I don't have the very original version, I am not sure. From the source code of Icarus, I found functions never used, and functions newly added. But one thing is sure, that is, Icarus has changed it trading logic from a traditional grid trading to what I described above.

What are you going to do when the price reaches a certain specific value? If you want the EA start to run at this value, you can set an alert on your MT4 terminal, when the price reaches the given value, give a notification to your smart phone and you can start the EA to run.  
  
If you want to achieve the highest possible profit, you should set the Profit Lock to a higher value, for example, 0.8. You have to set an appropriate grid size by dividing the range of swinging into few segments. As long as the market is still in ranging, you earn the money as you want and won't have a large draw down.  
  
Because Icarus does not has a real SL control, when the market turn to trending, you will lose a lot. What you can do is to set Account_Risk value to protect your account, for example, 0.3, Icarus will close all orders when the equity is less than the balance by 30%. And then you just lose 30% of your balance. However, set Account_Risk to a too small value could drag Icarus from achieving the possible highest profit.

Hello all, here is my thoughts on Flying Robin EA:  
  
I hope this robin can dynamically adapt to the wind to chase high, chase low, or hover to keep profits.  
  
It adopts virtual TP and virtual SL which are similar to Icarus. The calculation of virtual TP and virtual SL depends on the grid size. The following is abbreviated as TP and SL for simplicity. The difference is that when an order touches its SL, that will be regarded as a potential trending signal, and two opposite orders will be placed at the same time. One of these two orders is used to lock the loss, and the other is used to chase profit. When the reverse order reaches the same profit as the locked loss, close one of them together with the order that previously touched the SL. In this way, we can maintain the BE of the account.  
  
In addition, when an order touches its TP, Flying Robin will add an order along with the trend and performs profit lock. Profit lock can be based on Icarus' profit lock which is actually a trailing SL, or it can be calculated and partially closed orders to be a real profit lock. Then, close all orders when the total profit of the remaining orders in this cycle returns to zero.  
  
The Flying Robin will also be like Icarus. There are two cycles of buy and sell, and each cycle ends with a profit. However, in a with-the-trend trading, in addition to the newly added orders in the buy cycle when the TP is touched, there are also buy orders added when an order in the sell cycle touches its SL. And vice versa.  
  
Such a grid trading strategy seems to be just a with-the-trend strategy. If you want to take into account both with-the-trend and against-the-trend, you can adjust the Flying Robin still add a same direction order like Icarus when the last order in its cycle first touches its SL, and then put many orders to follow the trend when the previous same directional order added touches its SL again. ( the number of orders should be enough to eliminate the previous two losing orders when the trend continues, generally speaking, it should be at least greater than 4 to make BE and chasing profit.) I am going to let this adjustment could be arranged in the settings. In other words, if you want it to immediately follow the trend, it will immediately reverse the trading direction when it first touches the SL. If you want it to hover and watch, you can follow the trend when the second time SL is reached.  
  
For the sake of easily control, I am not going to use any progressive lots and place each order with a single basic lots. You can set the number of orders when placing new orders to achieve the purpose of incremental lots. This is also convenient for the subsequent closing of certain profitable positions when performing profit lock.  
  
The above is a brief summary of my thoughts, waiting for your advice and feedback.

Two modes for EA to work  
  
Semi-auto  
  
Work as a helper to the brain to give signals and manage execution. This means the brain will decide whether it's trending, sideways or flat market.  
A flat market means no trading.  
  
What will EA do after the brain decides to go for a trend  
1\. Direction decision  
2\. Risk to take  
3\. Performance goal: wins % loss % to decide on whether to use simple or complicated risk controls  
4\. Risk to manage  
By TP, by SL, by the hedge in opposite direction, or by cutting exposure time, by averaging losing positions, by pyramiding winning positions, use martingale, equity profit/loss.  
5 Fixed lots or variable lots  
6.Stick to the above simple risk controls or use complicated ones like profit protect, trail profit, breakeven, hedge lock and hedge release lock, re-hedge lock etc etc.  
  
II Sideways trading  
  
Brain estimates when sideway has started, how fast or slow will be the speed of momentum, when will it start and when will it end.  
  
**Auto trading**  
  
Find factors that can give stable or constant values for EA to replace the brain as a decision-maker and give entry signals. 

Practice makes a person perfect

What 123VPS is running is the prototype in the test  
My idea is to cancel Ikarus BB and add ATR volatility, moving average parameter identification trend and money management, plus pending order detection.  
The general idea is  
1\. Detect the value of yesterday's volatility and set the grid according to yesterday's volatility. Pending order batch trading (the first order is 0.3 at 100 points, the fourth pending order is at 130 points, the fourth is at 170 points, the fourth is 220  
  
2\. Use 5 8 13 21 34 55 to detect the current trend direction  
3\. When yesterday's volatility is 100 points, today's volatility is 3/1 to execute up and down pending orders  
4\. The method of pending order is low, long, high sell, and the number of pending orders is 3/6/9/13/16/21 (batch)  
5\. The way of entering the market is to use the initial appearance Fibonacci draw 3-3 draw the Fibonacci number adjust out %50 When the price rebounds or rises to the 50% position, all positions are closed  
6\. The fund management adopts the forced liquidation strategy to detect that the floating loss on the day reaches 10% of the total capital. Forced liquidation of all positions  
7\. Use moving averages to detect trends and execute low-to-multiple pending orders or high-altitude pending orders  
8\. Only work from the opening of the European market to the end of the US market in the morning, and stop trading at other times

For couple weeks of incubation, my little Robin is hatched out from its egg.  
  
Last weekend, I was training her to fly. My training environment is to do back testing from 3/22/2021 to 4/23/2021. The reason I take this period to be a back test window is, for some currency pairs within this window Icarus is very easily to touch the ground. Moreover, on a Demo account, I had put Icarus with 0.3 initial lots and progression 1, do a forward test of GBPUSD on last Friday, I set an initial account balance to 6000 USD, I received margin calls at the same day.  
  
I had trained my Robin with several currency pairs, EURUSD, GBPUSD, AUDUSD, NZDUSD and also AUDJPY, USDJPY, NZDJPY, GBPJPY. The training purpose is to find an appropriate settings for all pairs and set them to be the defaults.  
  
Robin acts a different way from Icarus. Let me explain the settings of Rabin as follows.  
  
When you use Robin, some settings are related. Virtual SL is related to the grid size directly, although Virtual TP is independent of the grid size, but you should set TP to a little larger than the grid size because Robin will try to chase the profit on one hand, and will try to as much as possible cover the loss of previous position on the other hand. If the TP is not larger than the grid size, it won’t has enough profit to cover the loss. My suggestion is set TP to 1.3 grid size. I like to use ATR to determine the grid size, the default settings of ATR is a relative better settings so far I had trained her. If you use ATR to determine the grid size, an appropriate TP is also be calculated at the same time.  
  
There are no balance control, no lots progression, no grid size progression in Robin because she doesn’t use them. However, there are three additional settings in Robin, they are,  
  
A. Hover for a moment before with the trend: Default setting is false, which means when Robin feels a potential trend is coming by a position reaching its virtual SL, she will reverse the direction of the new orders to follow the trend. Otherwise, she will still hover and open a new order against the trend as what Icarus did. When the newly added order hit its SL again, she then will reverse the direction to follow the trend.  
  
B. No. of opposite orders in changing direction: Default setting is 2. When following the trend, Robin will open two opposite orders. One for hedging the loss position to lock the loss. Another is used to chase the profit. You can try to set more than 2, but at least you should set to 2.  
  
C. No. of orders with the trend: Default is 1. When Robin in a with-the-trend state and a position reaches the TP, she will add a new order to chase the profit. Also, you can set orders more than one to chase the profit. Do not be afraid to set this value to 2, 3, or more. It totally won’t hurt your account but double, treble or more to get profit from you are chasing if the price continue goes to it direction (that’s why I set max positions to 10 as default, of course, you can set more. Setting a larger number of max positions won’t hurt your account at all. This is different to Icarus, Icarus will.) Robin employs the same profit lock control as Icarus, once a virtual TP is reached, profit lock control is enabled. When positions new opened are in a wrong direction profit lock control will close all positions in the cycle including positions you extra added for chasing the profit. I set the default to 1 is the most conservative setting for training purpose. (Icarus doesn’t open new positions to follow the trend when the virtual TP is reached, although I think it should do, otherwise it cannot take any advantage of the ongoing trend. I do have a desire to change this in Icarus but I didn’t, for the sake of keeping the trading logic of Icarus as pure as original)  
  
Indicators are only used to initiate a new cycle. I use BB(2.0) TF=M15 Period=14 to trigger a new cycle. If no use of indicators Robin will also open a pair hedging orders as Icarus does. I set ATR TF=M5, Period=14, Multiplier=2.0 for determine the grid size automatically. But you have to aware that this settings cannot be applied to Icarus. Why? To an against-the-trend grid trading, we need a smaller grid size. To a with-the-trend grid trading, the grid size should be larger. (At this moment, I realize why Icarus doesn’t put pending orders, because when using a smaller grid size, some pending orders could be refused by trading servers.)  
  
Lastly, May I ask everyone on this thread a favor? Could you please run BTs as well as FTs using my little Robin and feedback to me, so that I can make improvement?

No, you were doing nothing wrong. Only if you use BB(3.0) and together with STO indicator. That will be a very strict condition for triggering a trade. Do you know it only has 1/1000 of probability that the price will reach upper or lower line of BB(3.0)?

You can also tell us your indicators settings, so that we can figure out your problem.  
We don't have to use a very strict condition for indicator to trigger a first order. As long as we can assure that we buy at a relative lower price and sell at a relative higher price. That's enough. Gird trading strategy is not an one shoot decision.

Hi, guys,  
  
If you are using indicators to decide a better entry point of grid trading EAs, Icarus or my Robin, something you should know.  
  
When you set Selected indicators conjuncted apply (Robin) or All selected indicators will be applied together (Icarus) to "true," trigger conditions of indicators will be applied via logical AND relation. That is, the more indicators you choose to use, the less opportunities to initiate a trade, of course, the opportunities of take profit will be small.  
  
When you set the value to "false," note that it is not the default setting, one of the indicators reaches its trigger condition a trade will be initiated. That is, the more indicators you choose, the more opportunities to initiate a trade. The opportunities of take profit will be large.  
  
By the way, my first upload version of Robin 1.0 is use BB and COG together. I have already re-uploaded a new Robin 1.0 using only BB. You don't have to re-download it. It is still same as the previous one, you can just set the CoG is used to "false" for more opportunities to enter a trade.

It (Icarus or Robin) stops cycle only when the cycle is with max_profit marked and the profit is less than profit_lock*max_profit. In other word, it always closed with a positive profit.  
  
The case we need close a cycle manually via buttons yellow is you want to stop a negative profit cycle, because they won't close a negative profit cycle.  
  
You want it stop a negative profit cycle other than a positive one, you have to specify in what situation you have to close the cycle.  
  
For instance, if you set profit lock to 1, then when the last order of a cycle is reached TP and total profits of orders in this cycle is greater than 0 the positive profit cycle will be stopped. Likewise, if you want it stop a negative profit cycle you have to give me a condition for stopping the cycle.

It (Icarus or Robin) will show an Alert Yellow, when the account state reach max_positions. Total positions of buys and sells are counted separately. That is, when total positions of a buy cycle is greater than max positions or total positions of a sell cycle is greater than max position Alert Yellow is turned on.  
  
However, because the grid trading strategy of Rabin is quite different to what of Icarus, the meanings of positions of a cycle greater than max positions are also different. In Icarus, when a cycle reaches the max positions, it is always a negative profit cycle because Icarus is an Against-the-trend grid trading EA. Robin is a With-the-trend trading EA, a cycle reaches the max positions not necessary have to be a negative profit cycle. That is, you have to clearly specify what you mentioned new version EA is Robin or Icarus?

I think maybe I found the problem, it is because when you enable Alert Yellow at very beginning moment of Icarus is executed, there is no buy and sell cycles, that will cause a failure from trading server for the reason of an order is sent with 0 lots. (That is, when you press the BUY or the SELL button, a message box with you confirm you for the number of lots you are going to open, but it actually sent a zero lots to open the order.)  
Neither this is my coding error, nor a bug of Icarus. Because under normal cases, no one will try to open a first order manually at the very beginning moment.  
However, I can fix it for the sake of you want it to work that way. I use its function CalculateNextVolume() instead of taking number of lots from cycle array of buy_lots[] or sell_lots[] to send new order to trading server. And it works now as you wish, when you force it enter Alert Yellow mode from the GV settings it can open buy or sell order.  
  
The new modified version is then attached for you.

> {quote} Acoount_Risk is the SL Function...

Yes and No.  
  
Yes, the account risk control will protect your account from loss. It closes all cycles and pause (let EA quit from trades).  
  
No, the account risk control cannot be regarded as a SL function, because it is not watching at the loss of a single position (or even a cycle), it is watching your equity. When your equity is less than your account balance by the amount of given percentage of account balance, the account risk control will close all cycles, and Icarus is then stop running until you re-initiate Icarus to run. Icarus will close all cycles and stop all trades. That is, if you trade many symbols, for example EURUSD, USDJPY, and USDCHF, at the same time using Icarus, when account risk control condition is met, all your trades will then be stopped at the same time.  
  
So, do we need a SL control mechanism in Icarus? The answers still a 'yes and no' dilemma.  
  
Yes, because the grid trading strategy of Icarus is a kind of against the trend strategy, theoretically, an against the trend grid trading strategy is necessary to have  
a proper and appropriate SL control. If it does not have such control, you will receive margin calls soon or later. That's why Icarus always start with a good taking off but eventually end with a crash.  
  
No, Icarus only be a semi grid trading strategy, it accumulates its potential profit by its temperately losses. If you apply a proper SL control on Icarus, you also restrict it from getting profit. The positions in a cycle is increased, only when the previous position in this cycle reaches its virtual SL. That is why we will use progressive amount of lots to against the trend. We let Icarus accumulate the potential profit by temperately losses, and wait for the trend is stopped and the price goes to an opposite direction, a negative profit cycle will turn to be a positive profit cycle gradually, and then it will close the positive profit cycle if the profit lock condition is reached. As long as your account balance can survive from its the floating loss you will end with profit eventually. If the account balance cannot survive, the floating loss will become a real loss, position by position.

I tell you the reason why. Icarus prefers a smaller grid size but not too small. a too small grid size will cause margin calls.  
Then what is the appropriate grid size for Icarus? It depends on the swinging range of the market. That is why I suggest use ATR to decide the grid size.  
If You can predict the range of a swinging market by whatever means, for instance, 50 PIPs, you may divide 50 by n, where n less than the max positions you set, and greater than the number of new positions you are going to add progressively. You have to make sure that the temperately losses won't cause margin calls. For instance, if n=5, your grid size should be 10 pips, the total lots in your negative profit cycle is are 1+2+3+4+5 = 15*minlots if you set progressive to 1, you can then predict the worse case in the swinging situation the total loss of the cycle could be (1*50pips+2*40pips+3*30pips+4*40pips+5*50pips)*value(minlots) = 630 pips * value(minlots).  
As soon as you account can hold on, it is safe as long as the market is still in a swinging. However, when the market goes to a trending situation, perhaps, you are going to say a bye-bye to your account.

My coding is also not good, 6 months ago, I even don't know how to use MQL4 to code an EA. It is true, Icarus is a sophisticated EA, you have to understand its trading logic before you can modify it. The grid size is related to the calculation of virtual SL and virtual TP and that give us a dilemma. If we enlarge the grid size for the sake of not to put too many lots so soon, the enlarged grid size is then also delay the TP (profit goal) to be reached. However, we can solve the problem, if we can use two grid size value, say, grip_size_SL and grid_size_TP, calculated from the original grip_size separately, we can use one for calculating the virtual SL and other for calculating virtual TP.  
Talking about of how to use ATR to decide an appropriate grid size, it is a logic problem not a problem of coding skill. You have to know how ATR value be calculated and how do you use it. For instance, if you use ATR period 1 on the time frame 1D with the shift value 1, that means you are taking the swinging range of yesterday. You can use the swinging range of yesterday to predict today's range. There are many ways to predict the current range of swinging, and it is up to you. Once you have found your way to predict the range of swinging, you can then divide the size of range into segments according what grid size progression method you like. For example, if you choose 1 2 3 4 5 as the progression sequence and max positions is 6. Perhaps you can divide the range by 1+2+3+4+5=15 and use 1/15 of the range to be an initial grid size.

int ATR_Grid_Size()  
{  
int digits, scale=10000;  
digits = (int)MarketInfo(Symbol(),MODE_DIGITS);  
if (digits == 3 || digits == 2) scale = 100;  
if (Use_ATR) return ((int)round(ATR_Multiplier*scale*iATR(Symbol(),ATR_tf,ATR_Period,ATR_shift)));  
else return grid_size;  
}  
  
Because ATR value is in point scale, you have to multiple by 10000 or 100 to transfer it be a pip scale.  
Now you have a predicted swinging range of pip scale.  
  
The following I didn't code in the Icarus, anyone can calculate himself as he like. If you want the grid size can be automatically calculated according to the gs_progression, you can write a code to calculate, for example, if gs_progression = 1, max positions=6, you can divide the swinging range by (1+2+3+4+5)=15.  
For every gs_progression value, you can calculate similarly. That is, when the gs_progression is chosen, an appropriate initial grid size is automatically be calculated.  
  
In my modified Icarus 2.2.3 or later, you can use the Multiplier of ATR settings to adjust the predicted range of swinging. For example, if you are using gs_progression = 1, you can set Multiplier = 1/15 = 0.067 to fit your grid size progression setting.

I like to discuss with you all about the trading concept of using Icarus.  
Most traders think we should buy at a lower price and sell at the higher price. However, the traditional rule seems not be applied to Icarus.  
I had code modifications of Icarus to use indicators for helping us to find a better entry point. According to the conditions MaPi suggested to me, they are applied in traditional concept, that is, buy at low, sell at high.  
We know Icarus is accumulating the temperately loss and waiting the right moment to turn the loss to be positive profit. It add no new positions on a cycle when in profit. Hence, the sooner positions in a cycle is reached at its virtual SL, the sooner Icarus can accumulate the temperately loss for the future potential profit. It is strange to me that, Icarus does not add any new position when the virtual TP is reached.  
Perhaps, it could be better for Icarus if we let Icarus initiate a buy cycle at high and a sell cycle at low. (The nature behavior of an Against the trend grid trading strategy is sell at the lower grid line, and buy at the higher grid line.)

For the sake of distinguishing Icarus_2.2.4_modified and my new modify version, I name the new version to Icarus_M_3.0.  
  
Icarus_M_3.0 works as the same as Icarus_2.2.4_modified, except the indicators triggers is reversed from BUY-LOW/SELL-HIGH to BUY-HIGH/SELL-LOW and add a profit chasing option for chasing the profit in a positive profit cycle.  
  
The first changed from Icarus_2.2.4_modified is just reverse the timing to initiate a new cycle. But I think this is not the most important thing in a grid trading strategy. The original Icarus doesn't have indicators for helping to enter a trade, and use a pair of hedging order to initiate both buy and sell cycles maybe not a bad choice. Enter trades randomly can assure at least one cycle be initiated at a not bad entry point for Icarus. For this reason, I decide to code the modification of different way indicators' trigger as another version of Icarus, Icarus_M_3.0. So that you can run a cross comparison of Icarus_2.2.4_modified and Icarus_M_3.0.  
  
The second changed from Icarus_2.2.4_modified is adding a profit chasing option for chasing profit when a positive profit cycle reaches its virtual TP. If you set 'number of orders for chasing profit' to 0 (default), Icarus_M_3.0 works as it usually does. If set to a number greater than 1, say n, Icarus_M_3.0 will add n new orders (each order is with min lots) to the cycle when virtual TP is reached to chasing the with-trend profit.  
  
For the purpose of comparing, you can set 'number of orders for chasing profit' to 0 and use indicators to compare Icarus_2.2.4_modified with the same indicators settings. That can let us to know which one give us a better timing for enter the trade.  
  
You can also no use of indicators and set 'number of orders for chasing profit' to a value greater than 0 to compare the results of Icarus_2.2.4_modified and Icarus_M_3.0 to see whether or not Icarus should chase profit in the positive profit cycle.  
  
Icarus_M_3.0 is attached.

Hi, Alls,  
  
I would like to share you some interesting findings about grip trading logics.  
As you have already known I am tuning and improve my Robin these days. I found something interesting about grid size of grid trading.  
It seems to be a fact that success or failure of a grid trading depends on the grid size you chose. How to choose an appropriate grid size to trade is then become an issue.  
The original Icarus_2.2 does not have indicator like ATR for help to decide an appropriate grid size. Of course, you could run optimization of one year back test for some specific currency pair to find a better grid size from the historical market data in that year. However, the grid size fits for that year may not fit this moment, dare you or dare you not use the grid size in your live account grid trading?  
That's why I proposed using ATR to predict the grid size. Also, by the way, I have to advise you never set grid size progression value other than 0. A progressive grid size only suitable for a market in swinging expansion, however, swinging expansion state will terminate soon or later. The grid size is then far from an appropriate grid size when the range of swinging is shrank. If we can find a way such that the grid size can adapt to the market dynamically, would that be wonderful?  
We have rise two issues. 1. How to use ATR to predict an appropriate grid size? And, 2. How to make the grid size be adaptable for the current moment your are trading?  
To the first issue, my advisement is you have to know what ATR value give you and you have to have your idea to employ it. For example, if you set the Time Frame to 1H, Period to 5, shift to 0, ATR value give you a previous five hours average value of true range. It make some sense, you can use the value (not directly used, a multiplier is needed) to predict the swinging range of current moment. Above example is just an example, you can find your way to predict the range. If you find a good way, please share with us.  
To the second issue, I already make my tuning version Robin with its grid size adaptable to the market. The adaptable grid size will be used to calculate the virtual SL as well as the virtual TP. But Icarus is another story, because it use a fixed and static grid size going through all the trades. In Icarus, virtual SL is depended on the fixed and static grid size. The virtual TP is calculated separately according to what you set at the global variable setting. Don't you think the virtual TP should also be adaptively calculated? I can make the virtual SL as well as virtual TP adaptable dynamically, but I didn't do in the Icarus_M_3.1, because Icarus is not my own project. I should not arbitrarily do what I want to do.  
  
Cheers to every one.

About using ATR as a progression level, it is a good idea first of all. But it needs good optimizations to be accurate. In my view, short-term intraday ATR is not that reliable due to different sessions' true rang. What if we use 2 different ATR value as below:  
D_ATR: ATR which calculates the last day or two, true range  
W_ATR: Atr which calculate last week,s ATR  
These 2 ranges are just for example which needs to be optimized using settings. Then we can choose the bigger ATR for our calculations. Or even an average of these two. An of course a multiplied number of it would be the output for our grid size  
  
About TP calculations, after @MaPi 's confirmation, one thing would be feasible probably. However, I believe it is not an easy coding process.  
We can use a bool to check if the user wants to use TP as a fixed amount or it is needed to be calculated in your way.

Great, it is a good start of discussing the swinging range prediction.  
Do you mean 4*H4 is ATR(4) with TF H4 and 4*16*M15 is ATR(64) with TF M15?  
  
If we want to predict an appropriate grid size, we had better knowing how Icarus use the grid size.  
  
Icarus calculates virtual SL function is shown follows.  
  
double CalculateSL(double volume,int positions)  
{  
double aux_stop_loss;  
double myVal=CalculateVolume(positions)/min_lots; // myVal = # of actual progression  
aux_stop_loss=-(myVal*grid_size*CalculatePipValue(volume));  
return(aux_stop_loss);  
}  
  
and the grid size progression is used to calculate volume of lots of the last order in the cycle:  
  
double CalculateVolume(int positions)  
{  
int factor=0;  
int i=0;  
if(positions==0)  
return(min_lots);  
switch(gs_progression)  
{  
case 0:  
factor=1;  
break;  
case 1:  
factor=positions;  
break;  
case 2:  
for(i=1,factor=1;i<positions;i++)  
factor=factor*2;  
break;  
case 3:  
factor=CalculateFibonacci(positions);  
break;  
}  
return(factor*min_lots);  
}  
  
That is, the value of virtual SL in Icarus is not a value of price. It is an amount of money loss. This is quite different to the traditional definition of SL.  
Anyway, this is the only part Icarus use the grid size except those Icarus use for showing data or lines in the symbol chart.

Of course, it is different, ATR(4) with TF H4 is an exponential moving average of 4 hours true range, ATR(64) with TF 15 is an exponential moving average of 15 minutes true range. Normally, the former is larger than the later.  
  
Using ATR for grid size seems a simple concept, but has a sophisticated thought behind. One has to aware what true range is, and how ATR be calculated.  
  
A single true range is calculate as:  
TR = max(curr_High, prev_Close)-min(curr_Low, prev_Close)  
  
That is, ATR(1) with TF H1 and shift 1 is the true range of previous hour. ATR(5) TF H1 shift 1 is a exponential moving average of previous 5 true range of one hour.  
If you are using ATR for grid size, you must have your reason behind. For instance, I use ATR(5) TF H1 shift 1 as the base value to predict the swinging range and also to calculate the grid size, the reason behind is, I want to use previous 5 hours average true range as a base to predict. Why 5 hours? Because 5 is a Fibonacci number and 5 hours of time is suitable for market sessions switched and also market trend almost change its direction every 4-6 hours.  
  
Everyone could use ATR by choosing the period, the time frame, the shift value, and multiplier to find an appropriate grid size for Icarus. But I suggest before you use multiplier for tuning an appropriate grid size, you have to have your reason to support why to select the period, the time frame, and the shift. If you are not doing so, the combinations of various settings will drive you to crazy.

Grid size is just a value that Icarus use to calculate the virtual SL. If you are not sure what a grid size value should be set, you can use indicator ATR to help you.  
I code a function to calculate the grid size as follows.  
  
int ATR_Grid_Size()  
{  
int digits, scale=10000;  
digits = (int)MarketInfo(Symbol(),MODE_DIGITS);  
if (digits == 3 || digits == 2) scale = 100;  
if (Use_ATR) return ((int)round(ATR_Multiplier*scale*iATR(Symbol(),ATR_tf,ATR_Period,ATR_shift)));  
else return grid_size;  
}  
  
In Icarus_M_3.0, I put a statement to change the grid size if ATR is in used.  
  
grid_size = ATR_Grid_Size();  
  
Icarus will use the grid_size instead of the one you set in the parameters settings and the grid size will adapt each time the tick value change if ATR is used.  
That is, the calculation of the virtual SL is dynamical adapt to the range of swinging.
