BB trigger for Icarus M 2.2.4 is buy at low and sell at high. While BB trigger for Icarus M 3.3 is buy at high and sell at low. Note that Icarus is an against the trend grid trading EA. It makes profit mainly via the against the trend trading. That is, when a position reached its virtual SL, it added another order against the trend and accumulated losses progressively. When the trend is reversed, it turns the accumulated losses to profits. The more the losses it accumulated, the more profits it takes from the price reversal. BB Trigger for Icarus M 3.3 is let Icarus to accumulate the losses as soon as possible.  
  
It is a intuitive thought that using BB as a trigger indicator to buy at low and sell at high in a ranging market. But it is only for one trade one position trading. To an against the trend grid trading, one trade with many positions, if we follow the intuitive thought, we are not taking the advantage of the grid trading strategy of Icarus. That's why I developed another BB trigger condition that buy at high and sell at low for Icarus. It is Icarus M 3.3.  
  
Indicators are neutral depending how you use. For instance, if you use BB together with CCI (+100, -100) to trigger buy at high and sell at low, you will have a good trigger condition for a trending market. If you use BB with RSI and WPR to trigger buy at low and sell at high, you will also have a not bad trigger condition for a ranging market. I had implemented two single position trading EAs for trending and ranging market. I didn't share them here because they are not grid trading EAs. But I can show you a back testing result of the EA for trending market. Sorry, I can't share my EA. The main reason is once I share my EA, the EA will become a free EA to every one. I can not sell the EA in the future.   
But I can share how the EA be developed to you. As I mentioned above, the enter condition is BB+COG, I use ATR to automatically calculate the TP as well as SL. According to SL:TP ratio, I use ATR to calculate SL and sending order with SL set, but no TP set. When the price hits the SL, it exit with loss, when the price hit the instant TP calculate from ATR, it closes in profit. It is quite simple, and you can develop one for you.  
The difficult part to use such a simple EA is the settings tuning. You have to tune the BB parameters (time frame, period, std), you have to tune ATR parameters (time frame, period and ATR multiplier), also you have to tune the SL:TP ratio.  
Normally, if the trading strategy is determined a simple EA can be coded in couple hours. But to tune an EA for a specific symbol to make it works fine will take me couple of days. If you want to use an EA on your live account, you had better to know how to tune the EA. Any EA could be profitable if it is well-tuning.

Spread 0 only a bit unrealistic to the real case but no harm to determine whether or not the EA is OK.  
My screen shot is not a screen shot of Icarus. The trigger condition is BB+CCI, that is price reaches BB up band and CCI > 100 then buy and price reaches BB low band and CCI < -100 then sell. This trigger condition is trying to catch the moment that price go side walk along with BB up or low band. If the condition is met, it is very possible a trend is occurred. However, this trigger condition is only for my simple EA, and totally a with trend trading. So, this condition may not suit for an against grid trading EA, Icarus.  
  
If you want to find a better indicators for Icarus M 3.3, I suggest using BB to buy at high and sell at low with the filter of RSI within 32 to 68. That will indicate a ranging market. By the way, the RSI indicator in Icarus can not be set to as a trigger filter of within 32 to 68, you have to modify the codes for it works. The simplest way is to add your filter condition at lines 1328 and 1496 of the source code of Icarus M 3.3. The condition to be added is iRSI(Symbol(),RSI_tf,RSI_Period,PRICE_CLOSE,RSI_Shift) > 32 && iRSI(Symbol(),RSI_tf,RSI_Period,PRICE_CLOSE,RSI_Shift)<68  
For example, change  
if(!stopNextCycle && !restAndRealize && Indicators_Buy()) to  
if(!stopNextCycle && !restAndRealize && Indicators_Buy() && iRSI(Symbol(),RSI_tf,RSI_Period,PRICE_CLOSE,RSI_Shift) > 32 && iRSI(Symbol(),RSI_tf,RSI_Period,PRICE_CLOSE,RSI_Shift)<68)  
When done, recompile it.

Icarus 2.2 is not my EA. So are all the versions of Icarus. I only added indicators for triggering Icarus. The trading logic of all version are the same.  
But I can tell you that Icarus is basically designed for Forex, not for XAUUSD. For all currency pairs, 1 PIP = 10 points if the point value the broker gives to you is 5 or 3 digits and 1 PIP = 1 point if the point value is 4 or 2 digits. However, for XAU, 1 PIP = 1000 points if the point value is 3 digits and 1 PIP = 100 points if the point value is 2 digits. That is, a 2 digits point value will be regarded as the currency pair like USDJPY, so in Icarus 1 PIP is actually 0.01 PIPs of XAUUSD. It is not to say you can't run Icarus on XAUUSD, but you have to know if you set a 20 PIPs of grid size you actually set a 0.2 PIPs grid size for XAUUSD.  
Trying to enlarge the grid size by 10 times or even by 100 times, you will find Icarus is more profitable. Owing to the fact that Icarus is not one trade one position EA, no one can tell you the minimal deposit needed. It depends on the margin required, the max positions and the progressive amount of orders you set.

Hi All,  
  
Just want to share some information i found when browsing around regarding ATR  
  
**Calculate your Stop Loss and Take Profit Targets**  
  
The ATR stop loss for a long position is calculated by using the currency exchange rate and multiplying it by 1 minus the Average 1 month ATR over the year (the 4% mentioned earlier). We minus it from 1 because we want to work out a number that’s less than the current exchange rate.  
  
**Long Stop Loss** = Exchange Rate * (1 - Average Monthly ATR)  
  
Then the target is easy... it's just the current exchange rate multiplied by 1 plus 3 times the average monthly ATR over the year. This in the end works out as a 1:3 risk-reward stop loss and target based on volatility!  
**Long Take Profit Target** = Exchange Rate * (1 + Average Monthly ATR)  
  
  
The short side of the calculator is worked out the same but inverted the operator for stop loss and take profit (soft target).  
**Short Stop Loss** = Exchange Rate * (1 + Average Monthly ATR)  
**Short Take Profit Target** = Exchange Rate * (1 - Average Monthly ATR)

I have no experience of running Icarus on any account, demo, live or even back test.  
Your order sizes are strange, what is your init lots and lots progression? You have better show your settings for others can figure out whether or not your result is abnormal.  
But to my understanding of Icarus, the grid size is also virtual. Unlike traditional grid EA use a realistic grid, Icarus use grid size to calculate virtual SL, and the virtual SL of a given position is calculated from the open price of the position to a grid size of loss. That is, the grid is applied to your position's enter price not a fixed value.  
Also, Grid size 20 to XAUUSD is a very small grid. If you are running XAU, the grid size is better set to 200 or 2000.  
XauUsd normally with the spread around 50 point, the grid size 20 you set is not exceed the spread. Take the first position buy 0.11 at 1798.65, suppose spread is 50, then the Bid value should be 1798.15, and your virtual SL is 1798.65-0.20=1798.45. That is when you enter the position it immediately hit the virtual SL, and Icarus will open a new buy position for you. That's why serveral new orders is created.  
It is not a bug of Icarus, because Icarus is designed for forex trading not for Xau.  
Please read my post #1174

> I use Dukascopy as my broker. As a related question does the historical data for backtest vary by broker or is it all the same from Mql5.com?e
> 
> Ignored

Historical data from Mql5.com are not complete for accurate back testing because the minimal time frame of the historical data is 1 minute. It doesn't have any tick data within the 1 minute. MT4 generates tick value from the least time frame historical data but not the real tick value. That's why many people will download Dukascopy historical tick data to increase the accuracy of back testing. Because historical tick data recorded the actual Ask and Bid value of symbols on real market, the Ask and Bid value are irrelevant to any brokers, you can set the spread at back testing to more fit your broker's tick data. And, that's why it is impossible to have a 99.9% or 100% modeling quality for back testing. The spread of your broker is normally dynamic, even than you set a fix spread for back testing, it can not accurately represent the actual Ask and Bid tick value of your broker.  
  
The tick data downloaded from Dukascopy can not be used directly in MT4, you have to convert them to a fxt format in the tester/history directory of MT4 terminal. Note that, the fxt file is huge and will take your disk storage. So I cannot prepare too many symbols for a too long term of time interval tick data for back testing, what I can do is preparing tick data for one symbol I want to do back testing.  
  
I saw many people like to use Tick Data Suite to manage tick data for back testing. Tick Data Suite gives you a two weeks free trial version, and after then you are going to pay for use. Another service I have tried is Quant Data Manager, it offers a free version for life but with advertisement. I think the later is a better one.  
  
Tick Data Suit pugs some code into your MT4 terminal that provide a check box to decide whether or not using tick data, when you check it, the back test result will show you a 99.9% modeling quality. The 99.9% quality addicts many people and let them think they have a good modeling quality, but as mentioned above I don't believe the 99.9% quality is possible. I have tested no matter how bad your tick data are, when check use tick data, it always shows you a 99.9% modeling quality. That is, two different people all with a 99.9% quality, will have a different back testing results. I think Tick Data Suite use its pug-in to show a 99.9% to mislead you to pay your money for continuously using their product. It makes no sense to pay for Dukascopy, because Dukascopy historical tick data is a public and free source.  
  
Using Quant Data Manager to prepare historical tick data for back testing, two different people will have the same back testing result no matter what the brokers are. I think it makes more sense and it doesn't pug any code into your MT4 terminal but just convert tick data to fxt format for MT4 back testing. It is without any cheating actions to your MT4.

1\. ATR will be always recalculated at start of each cycle. (no need to add any logic)  
2\. ATR is used to determine the grid size dynamically. However, in Icarus, the grid size affects only the virtual SL rather virtual TP. TP is determined by your setting of TP. That is, Icarus doesn't use the grid size to calculate the take profit value. (Why? I don't know, but it is the Icarus original logic.)  
3\. Talking about the invert trigger of indicators. BB invert means when the price greater the BB up band we buy and when the price lower the BB low band we sell. It seems just revert the buy/sell direction. We don't have CCI indicator for triggering, if we have, together CCI > +100 with BB invert buy, the price is most likely goes a upward side walk along with the BB up band. I had coded a special version of Robin that has CCI indicator because I need. But to the indicators STO and RSI, to revert the buy/sell direction is meaningless. That's why, the invert setting is not revert buy to sell or revert sell to buy, but only means invert buy to not buy and sell to not sell. If the invert is checked, only the value within the upper and lower levers will trigger the trade. STO or RSI, it makes no sense sell at high value and buy at low value.  
The reason why I didn't put CCI indicator into Icarus 4.0 is because Icarus favors ranging market and hates trending market, CCI>100 or CCI<-100 indicates a potential trending market is going to happen. That's why invert on STO or RSI has its meaning. When STO or RSI value is within the upper and the lower level, means the market is most likely in ranging and you should trigger a trade and using BB (invert) as an indicator to trigger.

You can try to see what happens. However you have to aware that RSI and STO are not like BB indicator. Their value represent a relative strength of the PA but not the price value. My invert of RSI or STO is used for preventing enter a trade in a trending market. When you coded them as the logic same with BB invert, it will mean when the price goes a strong upward you sell and visa versa. I think it makes no sense. Also, RSI or STO is better to indicate a ranging market rather a trending market. (Because there are ceiling and flooring effects of these indicator, they are not so sensitive in the over bought and over sold region.) CCI is more sensitive in the higher price or lower price area. The reason I didn't prepare CCI for Icarus is Icarus doesn't need to find a trend to enter the market. Icarus prefers a ranging market.  
BB should be used as a main triggering indicator and RSI or STO should be used as a supplementary indicator that filtering the trade so that it will not be opened in a trending market.  
  
Also, I suggest you try to modify Icarus as attached follows, the sell part is similar.  
  

Attached Image (click to enlarge)

[![Click to Enlarge

Name: 2359fb373b5b197aa0450e747b517085.png
Size: 20 KB](/attachment/image/4046097/thumbnail?d=1632769285)](/attachment/image/4046097?d=1632769285)   

  
  
That will cause Icarus when triggering a trade, for instance a buy cycle is initiated, it will also initiate a sell cycle at the same time. That is, go back to the original logic of Icarus, a pair of hedging orders is opened simultaneously. If the triggering indicators you are using is invert BB and invert RSI or STO, the buy cycle will soon to accumulate the loss, waiting the price hits the ground and rebound to get profit. The sell cycle should become a profitable cycle at the cycle is initiated.

But for 2nd or 3rd positions in an opened cycle those indicators don't have such ability, therefore, a solution is setting a reasonable value for Minimum Spread. Because in savage conditions, [spreads](/brokers/spreads "View Live Spreads on the Broker Guide") go high and we can prevent EA from continuing the cycle unless market gets calm and consequently spreads become in range.

Icarus is designed for currencies pair by default, if you want to run it on other things you need to make sure the point value of digits as well as the pip value calculated are the same as currency pairs. For instance, Icarus calculate PIP VALUE as follows.  
  
// ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  
// CALCULATE PIP VALUE  
// ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  
double CalculatePipValue(double volume)  
{  
double aux_mm_value=0;  
double aux_mm_tick_value=ter_tick_value;  
double aux_mm_tick_size=ter_tick_size;  
int aux_mm_digits=ter_digits;  
double aux_mm_veces_lots;  
if(volume!=0)  
{  
aux_mm_veces_lots=1/volume;  
if(aux_mm_digits==5 || aux_mm_digits==3)  
{  
aux_mm_value=aux_mm_tick_value*10;  
}  
else if(aux_mm_digits==4 || aux_mm_digits==2)  
{  
aux_mm_value=aux_mm_tick_value;  
}  
aux_mm_value=aux_mm_value/aux_mm_veces_lots;  
}  
return(aux_mm_value);  
}  
  
It only consider 5 digits, 3 digits or 4 digits, 2 digits cases. For 5 or 3 digits case pip value is 0.0001 or 0.01, that is pip=10*point. This covers all the currency pairs but not other things. For example, US30 is an 1 digits symbol, the pip value calculation of Icarus can not be applied to US30. If you want to use Icarus on US30, you have to modify the codes of Icarus so that the calculation is fit for US30.

About the trading time restriction function, yes, I can do it. But I'll do it on Icarus 4.x later. Icarus 4.0 is nothing different to Icarus 2.2_Time version if you choose not to use any indicators. About another issue, the digits incompatible problem of Icarus when it used other than currency pairs, it is not so easy to modify to suit for symbols other than currency pairs. You have to aware in advance that Icarus calculate take profit is according to the take_profit value you set and its virtual SL is according the grid size you set. Take profit and stop loss (virtually) are totally irrelevant. Although I think it is a little strange but that it is. Also, Icarus use the actual value of money loss or gain to operate adding positions when the virtual loss is reached and performing profit lock when the TP is reached. A symbol other than currency pairs, that not 2 or 3 and 4 or 5 digits, will confuse its calculation of the actual money of gain or loss. Owing to the fact that Icarus is designed for currency pairs, it only consider situations of currency pairs but not other symbols. To have a comprehensive EA, it should take the value of digit, point value, and also pip value of the symbol from MarketInfo() function calls. But Icarus doesn't do this way. Icarus employs its special calculation everywhere and that makes modification much more difficult. I know what the problem is, but I just cannot solve the problem one by one to the symbols other than currency pairs.

How to Prepare Historical Tick Data for Back Test

Tick Data Suite? Quant Data Manager? Tickstory?

  
As I mentioned before, I don't trust Tick Data Suite because it embedded some code into your MT4 terminal such that the quality of back test can not be trusted. Quant Data Management is better but it also has its shortcomings. Using Quant Data Manager, it doesn't consider the spread so that the Ask and Bid are almost the same. That will cause you can have a wonderful back test result but never happen on the forward testing. So, we need a back test that can simulate merely actual spread. Tickstory can do it. As a consequence, I suggest you use Tickstory to run back test, it can add the spread according to your spread setting of back test. That makes your back test reasonable.   
  
A back test without spread considered. One can easily make an EA that give you an unbelievable back testing result as attached image. But such kind of back testing won't happen in the real world. You can see the back test result, initial deposit of 500 USD, from 2021.1.1 to 2121.9.30, the result balance is 538724.70 USD with the net profit of 538224.70 USD. Is it too good to be true? Yes. It is a false result.

It is not caused by restart of MT4. It is a normal close because the profit chasing order and the profit lock you set.  
When an order of the profit cycle reached its virtual TP, Robin will consider to add an additional order to chase the profit, and also, if you set a profit lock value other than 1, it will perform a profit lock function (something like a trailing stop). Robin will close all the orders in the profit cycle when the total profit is less than the profit lock factor multiply the maximum profit it ever reached. If you don't like it, you can set Profit Lock to 1.0, that will close the profit order immediately when the virtual TP is reached. And set No. of orders with the trend to 0, that will no additional order to be added for chasing the profit.

Yes. I can explain it. From Icarus 4.1 on, including 4.2, Icarus will open both directions buy and sell orders when the trigger condition is satisfied.  
The reason is, I think the original Icarus initiates both buy and sell cycles make sense and I want Icarus can go back to its original behavior even you use a trigger condition to initiate a first cycle.  
As I mentioned before, I suggest you can set indicators for triggering the first cycle as follows. Use BB invert and RSI or STO invert to set your trigger condition for the very first cycle, when the trigger condition is satisfied, that means the first cycle to be initiated has a large probability become a loss cycle. Why? Because BB invert indicates the price is above or below the upper or the lower BB band, and RSI or STO invert indicates the price behavior is most likely in ranging. That is, the cycle you initiated will soon become a loss cycle. And at the same time another direction cycle is also initiated, the cycle will soon become a profitable cycle. When Icarus accumulate loss by adding orders to the loss cycle, Icarus can also take profit from the profitable cycle.  
If you don't like both cycles to be opened at the same time, I can offer Icarus 4.3 to you. This version can let you choose whether or not to open both cycles.

Set to false to open only one cycle. Of course, you can also arrange triggering conditions so that the first cycle initiated will soon become a profitable cycle and not to initiate another direction cycle. However, according to my understanding of Icarus, I suggest use BB invert and RSI or STO invert to trigger both cycles. Because RSI or STO invert can also prevent Icarus from initiating a cycle at the trending situation as much as possible.

It is the nature of Icarus logic, Icarus's virtual TP is according to the Take Profit value you set and virtual SL is according to the grid size you set. Virtual TP and SL are independent. Of course, it brings a dilemma to us. If you set a relative larger TP value, of course, you can take more profit from the profitable cycle but it also limit the possibility of the loss cycle to turn its loss into gain when the price is reverse. Note that, when a virtual TP is reached, Icarus doesn't add additional orders to chase the profit.  
  
On the other hand, the reason I suggest to use BB invert is, we buy when the price is above the BB upper band and vise versa. It seems to put an order with a direction of against the trend, but that is exactly we want to. Because it will soon become a loss cycle so that Icarus can accumulate loss and waiting for the price being reversed to turn the loss into gain. (This is the mainly logic that Icarus make profit.) Icarus earn not so much via a profit cycle but earn a lot from the loss cycle when the price reverse its direction. Because in the loss cycle, Icarus adds many orders progressively, and the progressively added orders will bring you profits.

**![](https://resources.faireconomy.media/images/emojis/64/1f449.png?v=15.1)Multi Asset** **/ Multi Broker usage**

![](https://resources.faireconomy.media/images/emojis/64/1f449.png?v=15.1)**Time based start/stop:**  
Would be great to have an "Opening Mode" where we can set the time (HH:MM:SS) when the EA should open a long short trade and manages both directions AND only one cycle. I can understand what you are saying. I also know you are misunderstanding of the grid size means in Icarus. Grid size in Icarus only be used to calculate virtual SL of an order (or position). Assume you set 50 pips of grid size, Icarus will use 50 pips value as your virtual SL. Also, assume the spread is 20 pips, the loss of your order when opened is 20 pips, when the price goes to the opposite direction and the loss of the order increase to 50 pips, Icarus will open a new order. The effect is it seems open orders every 30 pips. Take a sell order as an example, your open price must be at the Bid price. And your loss is the spread, that is Ask-Bid. As the price is up, till the virtual SL is reached, the Ask is increased by 30 pips, then an new order is opened. The grid size is only used as virtual SL calculation but not to mean the distance between orders.

A suggestion for next update.  
  
1\. A choice be given to use indicator to trigger entry or buy or sell upon touching a defined Price Level. Any one.  
2\. Let progression of Buy or Sell start with a single order (can be any number of lots) up to a number of defined maximum positions.  
3\. If Buy is selected Increment of pip distance (Upwards) or decrement of pip distance (for averaging purpose).  
4\. In case of Sell, Fading of positions to be done (downwards) or increment (for averaging) .  
5\. Profit lock may not be required. TP may be defined for each increment.  
6\. On TP being achieved or exit by SL or Time , then trade size may be restored if user choses so.  
This becomes a continuous process even if one position is traded. And it becomes a set and forget trade.  
7\. This trade suits mainly Index trader and is purely a lucrative trade for those who can cope with psychologic pressures exerted by drawdown.

I am an option trader and have waited in the past for a couple of months when I sold options with 5 to 6 months maturity and have seen drawdown happening. Take a buy cycle as an example, take profit is according to the Take_Profit value you set. When the total profit of the buy cycle is greater than Take_Profit value, Icarus will mark the profit as the maximum profit and begin to perform profit lock, when the current total profit of the buy cycle is less than max_profit*Profit_Lock Icarus will close all orders in the buy cycle. For instance, if you trade currency pair with 1 lot and set Take_profit to 20, also you set Profit_lock to 0.9, then when the total profit of your buy cycle is greater than 200 USD the maximum profit will be set to 200. When time goes and your total profit of the buy cycle is shrank to 179 USD, it is less then 0.9*200, Icarus will then close all the orders in the buy cycle and take 179 USD as the profit.

Check the following codes in Icarus:  
if(unbalance_control==0)  
ticket=OrderSendReliable(Symbol(),OP_BUY,CalculateStartingVolume(),MarketInfo(Symbol(),MODE_ASK),slippage,0,0,key,magic,0,Blue);  
else  
{  
if(sells<4)  
ticket=OrderSendReliable(Symbol(),OP_BUY,CalculateStartingVolume(),MarketInfo(Symbol(),MODE_ASK),slippage,0,0,key,magic,0,Blue);  
else  
ticket=OrderSendReliable(Symbol(),OP_BUY,sell_lots[sells-3],MarketInfo(Symbol(),MODE_ASK),slippage,0,0,key,magic,0,Blue);  
}  
Which means if you set unbalance_control other than 0 Icarus will do unbalance control by putting more lots in the opposite cycle when it is initiated. That is, in English, when Icarus initiates a new cycle, it will check the number of positions of the opposite cycle. If the positions of the opposite cycle is larger than or equal to 4, it will open an order with the lots same as position 1 (the second position) of the opposite cycle to make the amount of lots of buy order more balanced to the amount of lots of sell cycle. If the opened positions of the opposite cycle is 5, Icarus will open an order with the lots same as the 3rd position of the opposite cycle, and so on. This is somewhat a hedge effect.  
Of course, (sells<4) can be modify to (sells<3) or (sells<2) to make Icarus performing unbalance control earlier.  
For now, Icarus makes the number of positions of opposite cycle fixed to 4. Perhaps, we can let the number be adjustable in the settings and maybe the problem of drawdown and margin load can be solved nicely.

  1. BB: If invert is false cycle starts Long/Short **outside** the bands (e.g. 3 StDev), if it´s true cycle both cycles can start **inside** the bands
  2. Stoch: If invert is false cycle starts Long/Short **outside** the input (e.g. 20/80), if it´s true cycle both cycles can start **inside** the input
  3. RSI: If invert is false cycle starts Long/Short **outside** the input (e.g. 30/70), if it´s true cycle both cycles can start **inside** the input
  4. Add a new option where trader can choose if EA should with the trend (e.g. above 3 StDev Bollinger = BUY) or against the trend (above 3StDev Bollinger SELL)

**Icarus v4.0.1_Beta**

**With HEDGE Function**

  
Dear Fellow Traders;  
Here is the Beta version of Icarus 4.0.1 attached which is equipped with the HEDGE function.  
  
Let's take a look at bellow picture which shows opened positions for the main cycle (Buy in this example) and Hedged positions (Sells)  
In this example position **_1,2,3,5,7,9_ are for the main cycle** while position **_4,5,8,10_ are Hedged** ones.  
The Hedge function here is set to trigger on 3rd position of the cycle (which is very low and is just for testing and debugging the EA)  
  

Attached Image (click to enlarge)

[![Click to Enlarge

Name: Icarus 4.0.1.jpg
Size: 331 KB](/attachment/image/4073524/thumbnail?d=1635865458)](/attachment/image/4073524?d=1635865458)   

  
  
A new hedge is triggered whenever the next position of cycles needs to be opened and at the very same moment, the first open position of the cycle gets closed.  
It goes further until Buy_TP (in this example) is triggered and all the positions will be closed.  
  
This function will be absolutely effective on lowering the Drawdown and consequently lowering the risk of account blowing up.  
Compare 2 pictures bellow to get what I mean:  
  

Attached Image (click to enlarge)

[![Click to Enlarge

[![Click to Enlarge

Because BB is not like RSI or Stoch, it represents a trend of price action, not the oscillation of price. That is, BB invert means when the price is greater than upper band we buy and lower than the lower band we sell. Normally, we don't need set invert of BB for Icarus, better for Icarus is to prevent opening cycles from a trending market.

To an against the trend grid trading EA, you cannot just invert your triggering condition to change it to be a with the trend EA. When virtual SL is reached, Icarus will open a new order against the trend. That is why, Icarus is classified as a kind of against the trend EA.  
  
Owing to fact that Icarus is essentially an against the trend EA, it is very difficult to add hedging mechanism into it. For hedging orders is essentially a with the trend order. Acquiring skills of Hedging Management needs at least 3 years actual experience doing it. Who has that patience?  
If you want to do auto trading for risk managment, discard all ideas to enter trades by using indicators. Discard stop loss and all risk management filters.  
Just set up two grids one for buying and another for selling.  
You can use 50 pips difference between the start price of the two grids or if you have a bias for buying , then set up pending orders at a price you perceive to be going to be support level below the start price or resistance level above the Start Price. Set up xxx number of pending orders for Buy Limit (buy from weakness) and Take profit periodically . Or you can pile up buys from Buy Stops and Take profit as prices go up. Similarly you can do selling from Limit (from strength) or Selling Stop and take TP partially. Two grids will provide natural grids. Risk management is done automatically. Entries are triggered without using any indicators.  
Only 6 price levels set up as pending orders above and below Start Price will act as TP 1, TP 2, TP 3 at resistance levels for buys and TP 1, TP2, TP3 at support levels for sells . You can buy/sell from above or buy/sell from bottom depending upon your bias for direction. 

Practice makes a person perfect

I am not stuck in the logic of Icarus. My replies is only to somebody want me to add hedging function into Icarus.  
  
There are many ways to design a grid trading EA, of course, we don't have to be stuck in Icarus. Instead adding hedging function into Icarus, I would rather to discuss a new grid trading strategy for a new EA. We can discuss and specify new trading strategy of this new EA. Then, we can build a new one.  
  
We should first decide the grid trading EA is a with trend or against trend. Next, we are going to specify the relationship of the grid size and take profit as well as stop loss value. For instance, Icarus's SL is according to the grid size and TP is totally independent of the grid size. Also, Robin's SL is proportional to TP and TP is depending on the grid size. There are many to be decide of the EA's control logic, we have to clarify the details before we can begin to code it. Create a new thread or discuss in this thread is all right to me. However, the most important thing is must has brainstorming here or there. Without any constructive opinion focus on the topic, every talks are eventually in vain.

The hedging method of Mr. Trader has to make a big modification of Icarus such that would rather to develop a new EA. To modify Icarus is much more difficult comparing to developing a new EA.  
The against trend nature is the base of profitability of Icarus, also a dangerous to the account when price has a big move. Hedging is incompatible to the against trend trading logic. If we change the against trend nature of Icarus, then we can do hedging. However, if against trend nature of Icarus is changed, the profitability of Icarus is also lost. Yes, it is a correct approach. One can develop an EA for protecting Icarus purpose. The protect EA can monitor Icarus and put opposite orders when Icarus is adding new orders. When the price is bouncing back, the protect EA can close orders grid by grid. With the protect EA, Icarus will never crash because the loss of Icarus can be balanced by the protect EA. Also, the protect EA is an isolated EA, it won't affect the profitability of Icarus. Only thing you have to control well is open and close orders in the protect EA. Note that, the protect EA is not for making profit propose, it serves a protection mechanism for Icarus.

It is better to have two cylces (a) with the trend (b) against-trend. And allow weight to be given for each cycle.  
With the trend can use from 50% to 100% of quantity lots based on your own directional bias  
At the same time you may input from 0% to 50% lots for against the trend.  
Using both cycles in proportionate lots will act as natural hedging.  
It works well for futures traders to have facility for two symbols and quantity in the EA connected with each of the two cycles. Profit or Exit for each cycle has to be there as well.  
  
If you want to use two symbols of same contract. Example both SP500 ES (mini ) and MES (micro) futures have different symbols but can work as natural hedge.  
ES (with tick value of 1) can be with the trend and MES(10) can be for selling. In such a case you will utilise single margin of ES and thus hedging will be in effect.  
It will require skills of trading. With the Trend (for instance use it at support level) and Against the trend (say resistance level) , you may see the progress for sometimes before closing the cycle with profit and bank upon the other cycle to work as per your own bias.  
  
Indicators can't provide you bias. This is your own skill of entering and exiting trades that will determine the profitabilty.  
  
Why EA then? Because it executes trades expeditiously and saves lot of time in manually entering trades and does not allow you to be fickle minded and helps stick to your strategy. 

Practice makes a person perfect

Hi. The best configuration is the one you are most comfortable with, between the profit and the maximum loss you are willing to accept. Icarus is mainly intended for reversal or counter trend trading. There is no 100% profit setup, because sooner or later, the market can blow up your account.  
  
My advice is to "play" with Ikarus. Open several demo charts, and on each one give it a different configuration and note how it behaves, it is a learning curve that you must go through, if you want to be profitable. Success!  
  
My comment is based on my own experience and the way I trade, which is in strong and important zones, and I go only in buy or sell. I do not use the internal indicators, maybe someone else can give you some configuration to use the indicators, if that is what you intend to use.

@MaPi @TeChaoLiang @Farzad666 and others interested. I have a suggestion to get out of trouble (when the account, in my case to open many orders) and that I usually implement.   
  
It is based on closing the FIRST profitable orders, with the FIRST losing orders, and the last order that goes in profit I leave it open. Why do I do this? Because many times, the market is only making a small reversal (and not a change of trend), and then continue to be overbought or oversold, if I read that it is only a small reversal, then I close the profitable orders, with the first losing orders. By eliminating the losing orders, I can lock in profits with the last one or two orders that go into profit. Sometimes I get it wrong and the market ends up going even more in my advantage, so the previous losing orders would have been recovered, but I prefer to make sure that if the price goes against me again, the previous losing orders are not even more losing.  
  
I know that many use the internal indicators and trade both ways, but I also think that you can implement it in your way of trading, for example, closing sales when you have buys at profit. But the idea is to leave the last or the last and second to last orders with more profit open, because otherwise it would not make sense.  
  
You could execute the closings, when you reach a certain amount of open orders, or when you reach a negative % in the account...etc. And then stop closing when you have closed X amount of orders or when you have recovered from the negative %.  
  
I hope you get the idea. I don't currently have a real situation where I need to remove orders. But, the attached screenshot is just an example that I drew, for better understanding of how I do it.  
  
Success!

Your Profit_lock is set to 0.3, that is, the maximum profit of the sell order is 29.75 so the profit lock = 29.75*0.3 = 8.93, when its current profit is less than 8.93 it will close the order. When the profit goal is reached, Icarus will begin to perform the profit lock process. If you set Profit_lock to a higher value, say, 0.9 or 0.8, the sell order would be closed already.  
You have to aware that, the default settings never means a best or even a better settings.

Hi TeChaoLiang,  
  
Can you please use grid size space to draw Maximum Drawdown Zone based on the tolerance level in Pips or Points input by the user to enable continuation of trend?  
User inputs  
(a) Maximum Positions drawdown for tolerance  
(b) Maximum pips/points for each position.  
(c) Price Level to hold for maximum drawdown  
(d) Drawdown cooling or buffer pips distance to tolerate drawdown for the pullback to happen and continue.  
  
Risk control measurement  
  
(d) Trade with compounding and discounting simultaneously. Requires less capital. How much, let EA calculate virtual capital either in total pips or total amount.  
(e) Trade with no compounding (use maximum positions at once) but with discounting (when managing with partial profits from selling). Requires more capital.  
Let EA calculate it  
  
Example:  
  
1\. 10 maximum Buy limit (or buy stop) positions are traded at one time at price level of 1.10 price and TP marked at 20 pips. Probable TP = 10 x 20 pips = 200 pips. Drawdown risk: 10 pips for each pip movement in price level going downwards.  
  
2\. User defines 1.00 price level as reasonable cooling period to tolerate drawdown.  
  
3\. User defines 0.95 as price level to act as buffer distance ends.  
Trigger proportionate hedging by selling 1 position at a time.  
  
4\. Please use discounting formula to calculate positions required to manage drawdown and reach a point of liquidation where profit starts accumulating from  
the selling of partial trades enough to offset the drawdown arising from Buying. I am not sure it could be 40 or 50 positions or more to reach this level.  
At this point drawdown risk is offset by selling generating partial profits.  
  
Simulating same scenario using **compounding (scaling up) for Buying and discounting for Selling (scaling down)** , the capital required will be substantially less. Let EA calculate it.  
  
On the whole, it is important to calculate risk money before trading  
  
(a) Hedge with Equal positions of 10 at price level 0.95 (giving chance for the trend to pullback and continue in buy direction). The drawdown will be completely locked at pip difference between 1.10 to 0.95 . It is to buy time temporarily .**Not a favored solution** for inexperienced traders.  
  
(b) Hedge proportionally using Grid starting at price level 0.95 at a distance of 100 points for 1 position with TP of 100 points for maximum of 20 positions. If after starting entry just for 1 position, the pullback happens, then the drawdown for buy will be from 1.10 to 0.95 and if the trend continues in favored direction, the drawdown will start getting reduced though TP until 10 positions hitting TP (calculated between 1.10 to and 1 positions hitting loss. **Ideal situation. At most, only 1 hedged position will create drawdown.** Compounding in a way works here.  
If buying continuation does not happen, then discounting by selling should work. Let EA calculate at what point discounting will offset Drawdown happening from Buying.  
  
Entry can be by any indicator RSI or BB or Moving Average, support and resistance levesl or by discretionary/manual trading.  
Important is risk control.  
Once EA tells you what could be the maximum risk you face, then if you have sufficient financial resources, trade it. Or drop it if your pockets are small enough not to take such a risk.

When you run Icarus on different charts with a same symbol, you have to change the magic number of Icarus for different charts. This way, Icarus won't close all orders on all charts. When an EA of some chart first found Account_Risk is reached, the EA will close all orders of the chart it's on only. If after orders of this chart has been closed and the Account_Risk is still reached, then another EA of another chart found it and another EA will also close all orders from the chart it belongs. I suggest you also arrange different Account_Risk value for different charts. This way, you can risk the capital per chart. You have to aware that no matter how many charts you are running Icarus, if you use a same Account_Risk setting then the Account_Risk is reached on one chart, it will be reached on every charts, because all charts are in a same account.  
To proper manage you capital risk, the best way is separate your capital into different accounts because Account_Risk is calculated by account not by chart and not depend on EA. There is no way to implement Icarus to met your requirement.

I have found in my forward manual testing that using double grid for scalping or day trading for moderately trending or range trending bias using pullbacks/retracements for buy limit orders for beakout and accumulating positions by setting up scalping grids on both buy and sell sides just using TP without SL controls risk very well and is good for any trader having no bias for direction. Have to monitor the equity account constantly.  
  
Margin used is lesser and TP has to be achieved by manually closing all trades and have to totally avoid attracting margin call by not closing any one side first.  
  
Traders having bias for a side moving more than the other side say for each market price move the market moves by 75% for buy and 25% for sell, then grid distances from Entry price for buy and sell can not be equal. Those have to be planned seaparately.  
  
For instance 75 pc may be converted into 7 pips TP for each trade and accumulation distance for pullback should be 5 pips. Sell should start at a distance of 75 pips from entry price and then take TP at each price decrement of 7 pips and accumulate at each pullback of 3 or 4 or 5 or 6 pips depending on the user's estimate of how long this moderate trend will last.  
  
Essentially three zones are to be drawn linked with start entry price (which could be market price or any price chosen). A zone where you think market would get weakened. Another zone where the market will be active. Third zone will be for drawdown risk management if you have conviction in your bias and you want to take risk by closing buy or sell selectively using close all buys or sells with profit or loss.  
  
If have neutral bias, then close all with equity profit or loss is good enough.   
  
Broker has to have hedging platform. Netting brokers have to have two different symbol for same index for the double grid to work .

double ATR_Grid_Size()   
{  
int digits, scale=10000;  
digits = (int)MarketInfo(Symbol(),MODE_DIGITS);  
if (digits == 3 || digits == 2) scale = 100;   
if (Use_ATR) return ((int)round(ATR_Multiplier*scale*iATR(Symbol(),ATR_tf,ATR_Period,ATR_shift)));  
else return grid_size;  
}   
Above is the source code of function ATR_Grid_Size(), the code is only suit for currency pairs. If want to for any symbols, you have to find the PIP value of those symbols and change (int)round(ATR_Multiplier*scale*iATR(Symbol(),ATR_tf,ATR_Period,ATR_shift)) to (int)round(ATR_Multiplier*iATR(Symbol(),ATR_tf,ATR_Period,ATR_shift)/PIP)   
  
Indicator ATR will calculate the average true range in point unit. Different TF, Period will bring you different average. Normally, ATR for larger TF will larger than smaller TF ATR. Smaller period will reflect the volatility near to the current moment. For instance, ATR(1) means the actual range of the given K bar depend on the shift value. Because Icarus prefer a ranging market, the ATR multiplier should not be large than 1, perhaps 0.2 or 0.3 is a proper setting.  
ATR is also can be used to determine the take profit value, for the same reason, it should not be larger than ATR value.  
  
if (Use_ATR) {  
grid_size = ATR_Grid_Size();  
take_profit = 0.9*ATR_Grid_Size()/ATR_Multiplier;  
  
Above is ATR used in Icarus, perhaps 0.9 of take_profit is a little large, you can modify it in the source code and recompile the EA.

Yes, you are correct, because I put the ATR in the part of Icarus code that will only be executed at the EA start for once.  
  
if(isFirstStartLoop)  
{  
if(AccountCurrency()=="EUR")  
ter_currencySymbol="€";  
if(MarketInfo(Symbol(),MODE_DIGITS)==4 || MarketInfo(Symbol(),MODE_DIGITS)==2)  
{  
slippage=user_slippage;  
ter_chartMultiplier=1;  
}  
else if(MarketInfo(Symbol(),MODE_DIGITS)==5 || MarketInfo(Symbol(),MODE_DIGITS)==3)  
{  
ter_chartMultiplier=10;  
slippage=ter_chartMultiplier*user_slippage;  
}  
// do we have any data from previous session?  
ReadIniData();  
debugCommentStat+="\nNew program start at "+TimeToStr(TimeCurrent());  
if (Use_ATR) {  
grid_size = ATR_Grid_Size();  
take_profit = 0.9*ATR_Grid_Size()/ATR_Multiplier;  
}  
isFirstStartLoop=false;  
}  
  
If you like each cycle the ATR can be recalculated, you can move the ATR part out and put it to some where you like.  
However, it is not so appropriate that let the ATR recalculated at every iteration of tick changed. That will confuse the grid trading logic. The better approach is to put it in the block that a new cycle be initiated, that is, at the buys=0 and sells=0 part.

Show the error message. I think the problem is from your broker. There are expression in Icarus will be divided by tick value for calculating the MaxLoss or ticksbyprice. When Icarus obtain the Tick Value from your broker, it get a zero in return, then the divided by zero occurs. Normally, no matter what symbols are, the tick value should not be zero. Most EAs will use tick value to calculate somethings. Perhaps your broker deliberately set tick value to zero to prevent any EA running on some specific symbols. Zero tick value won't affect manual trading but will stop EAs running.  
Try to use the script attached to see whether or not your broker deliberately give you a zero tick value.

To the suggestion of open a new profit chasing cycle will be more sophisticate. Because in addition to original buy/sell cycles, Icarus will has two more cycles to manage.

It seems that your broker give you a wrong point value. Normally, the point value should not be zero. Try to use marketinfo to check whether or not the point=0.  
When using MarketInfo() to obtain the point value from the server of your broker:  
ter_point=MarketInfo(Symbol(),MODE_POINT);  
and the server give you a zero return, Icarus will encounter a divided by zero error when calculate:  
buy_tar=aux_tp_buy/(buy_pip/ter_point);  
  
The point of DAX should be 0.1 not 0.

Partial closing of orders with profit is a good risk measure.  
Further you can have a choice of re-entering positions if pullback/retracements continue to hit old positions from where partial closing was done.  
  
In my experience, I have generated up to 50 repeat trades from a single point when during prolonged consolidation, the price point is repeatedly going up and down and hitting pullback/retracement points.  
  
It is a cycle like: Take profit, go back to the entry point, add new position, go for profit and keep repeating this cycle . 

Practice makes a person perfect

Suppose the current value of BB upper line is BBU and of BB lower line is BBL.  
ASK BID means when current Ask < BBL will trigger a buy signal and when Bid > BBU will trigger a sell signal.  
High Low means when current LOW < BBL will trigger a buy signal and when HIGH > BBU will trigger a sell signal.  
Above is normally use BB indicator.  
when you check Invert Trigger to be true, then  
ASK BID means when current Ask > BBU will trigger a buy signal and when Bid < BBL will trigger a sell signal.  
High Low means when current LOW > BBU will trigger a buy signal and when HIGH < BBL will trigger a sell signal.

These functions are not difficult to be added. However, they are meaningless to Icarus. Firstly, Icarus doesn't care whatever the timeframe is on your chart that is running Icarus, that's why the dropdown-menu for the time frame is meaningless. Also, a position can be opened at the opening at the opening of any candle is meaningless to a grid trading EA such as Icarus. To make a position be opened at the beginning of a given candle depends on what time frame you choose. M1 means open position only at minute begin, M5 means every 5 minute begin, 5, 10, 15, ..., M15 means every 15 minute begin, 15, 30, 45, 0, and so on. Open positions at some specific time is not match the trading logic of Icarus.  
  
The functions you mentioned can be applied to some trading strategy, such as "Trading Made Simple," but not for Icarus.

I was not talking about manual intervention or using Buttons.  
Automated trading approach needs clarity to map out the whole process and make rules that an EA can understand and execute.  
  
Building Grid pending order set up needs  
(a) Start Price (normally it is market price) for **Buying Limit**  
(b) Top Price ( TP) , above market. **Profit Zone**. Grid stops after exiting with take profit.  
(c) Bottom Price (BP) below market and below TP. **Drawdown** zone. Grid gets stuck here if pullbacks cease .  
(d) **Accumulation** steps for drawing the grid  
  
What I am suggesting is setting up of a micro grid (**PPT) or** partial profit zone between the Profit Zone and Drawdown zone to take partial profits  
  
It is in **PPT** grid rinse and repeat cycle will take place. Ideal trading environment is sideways/ consolidation/mild trending only.  
In **PPT zone** after take partial profit, pullback takes you back to the entry point, adds new position and the cycle continues as long as the pullback keeps touching the past entry price and generating buy orders.  
  
It is easier to construct rules for EA to execute trading where orders would be repeatedly put back when the pullback touches the original order placed .

Hi TeChaoLiang,  
  
Can you please make a semi-automated EA version of Robin that draws double grid based on following market conditions for HEDGING purpose only  
  
(a) Strong trending - **NO HEDGING**  
(b) Moderate trending  
(c) Sideways (shuttling between support and resistance)  
(d) Sideways drift (compressed moves)  
  
An automated EA can also be used to enter (b), (c) after any indictor or logic has identified Strong Candles losing momentum speed. Strictly to enter after Big Candles have slowed down after trending has hit peak or bottom.  
  
What Traders have to do:  
  
1.  
Estimate Exit by pips size of TP or SL based on volatility statistics for all four market conditions  
Estimate Exit by Bars Numbers or Timeframe based on News time/Open/Close Hours  
  
Trader to select Timing based on a view (formed by using indicators or not).  
Trader can make an educated Guess. EA can't do that using any of the technical indicators that easily.  
  
EA can do for (a) Strong Trending: UP/DOWN: Use Buy/Sell Limit (accumulate by pullback) + Buy/Sell Stop (providing further thrust to buying/selling ).  
  
2\. Hedge or not?  
  
Hedge provides natural risk management by setting up double grid without the use of breakeven or trailing stop. Only required utilities for Equity loss or profit controlled by Close all or close with profit or close with loss.  
  
Ideal for (b), (c) and (d) conditions. **Not for (a)** which needs independent risk management by the use of Breakeven, Trailing Profit, Margin% lock (equity loss stop or profit equity increase exit)  
  
If hedging is allowed by the broker platform, then buy and sell can be done for same symbol.  
If hedging is not allowed (FIFO or Netting) , find symbols of same asset that can be used in opposite direction  
  
3\. Trader wanting to do natural hedging without depending upon locking or unlocking has to take a firm view on Timing  
(b), (c), (d)  
  
4\. For natural hedging, EA makes risk management easier by counting increase or decrease in equity and exiting by Close All, Close with Profit, Close with Loss linked to Margin% increase or decrease.  
  
(b) ,(c) and (D): Use Buy Limit +Sell Limit for UP direction. and for DOWN direction use BUY Stop + SELL stop  
  
User has to take a firm view on how to use Support and Resistance, Fibos, BBs, MAs, Envelopes, Boxes, etc. Key will be the location of the grid or distance between  
the high low range. It needs some planning as to a middle point where prices are likely to turn.  
  
If trader decides to time it by entering via EA, then EA can use any of suitable technical indicators. Though my preference is for the trader to watch chart and then decides the likely points of exhaustion after determining the Range to be traded.  
  
**Second phase will involve setting up of Partial Profit Trading for Double grid.**

Practice makes a person perfect

**gs_progession** : Factor to expand grid_size

  1. 0 = Disabled, all orders will have the same distance
  2. 1 = Distance between orders will grow 1/2/3/4/5… (D’Alembert)
  3. 2 = Distance between orders will grow 1/2/4/8/16…(Martingale)
  4. 3 = Distance between orders will grow 1/1/2/3/5…(Fibonacci)

GS_Progression is set grid size progression. 0 means keep the same size, 1 means 1, 2, 3, ..., 2 means 1, 2, 4, 8,..., 3 means 1, 1, 2, 3, 5, 8.  
Account_Risk use to control account risk, value from 0 to 1. If set to 0.3 means when equity is less than the account balance by 30% of account balance will close all orders and stop.  
Show_Forecast 0 or 1, 1 means show the forecast information on the chart.  
Initiate Both Cycle When Indicators is used means when indicators triggering a trade will initiate both buy and sell cycle. Original Icarus does not use indicators for triggering trade, it just beginning with both cycles at the same time. Select false, buy and sell cycle will be initiated separately.

i do not have your exact settings for Icarus,   
  
But i do know that you are using fixed grid settings. There will come a time where there will be 1 way trend and the only option for fixed grid setting is to add money as buffer if trend is really strong. Otherwise, we would experience margin call. That is my life even before i studied Icarus. We can limit this by using triggers, i am using BB as trigger which makes my trades more "intelligent" - more of a sniper waiting to trade quick and clean, and i do not use "Initiate both cycle" as this also causes out of place trades that can cause unwanted drawdown.   
  
My backtest workflow is to have a priority of low maximal drawdown in 1year period, and then slowly work my ATR Settings to give me a grid and TP multiplier that will improve my profit and yet still minimize my drawdown. I think this is the answer for Grid trading, contract grid for tight range, and expand as needed so that Drawdown will not be too big.   
  
My dream is to not ever add capital to my trading account because of drawdown.   
  
Maybe it is soon possible. With a little more work.

AS you can see, i was able to lower maximal drawdown to less than my initial capital of 1,000.

i am just basing my answer on your chart.  
As you can see, you have 3 trades all close to each other, if you intended to only have 3 max trades, then your trades are too close to each other.  
  
  
You have 2 choices,  
1\. add to max trades so that when market goes to a pullback or retest, then you would easily Take profit.   
2\. Widen your grid, so that those 3 trades wont be too close to each other.   
  
I suggest to tweak your settings to add some more trades, and adjust your grid size and TP.  
  
For your question about stop loss, at that example, you will lose a lot of money, better change your settings forst before considering SL. You can use the hot buttons for stop loss, close all sell or close all buy.

I am trying to understand how it is going on your screenshot.  
I start here a visual backtest  
  
On this screenshot, (EURUSD M10) you can see a buy trade triggered by EA, the price goes up,and the dash line goes up also and after stay waiting.  
At this time , you have equity which can grow very high over balance but like the cycle is not closed , it can stay a long time like this , it's why you have the green equity line moving far over the balance line.  
During this time, EA can start also other cycles,so it is difficult to analyse really. But apparently, Icarus is not wrong and makes his job correctly.  
\- On your screenshot, when you have the big down peak , Icarus triggered another cycle,and has compensated and we can see this in load at the bottom of the tester  
On this screenshot , after when the price goes down to the blue dash line , the cycle is closed, and the profit is taken.  
I hope I am not wrong and I think it's not really a bug.

You have to aware that the symbol property of XAU is different to currency pairs. PIP is a unit specific for currency pairs. That is, for every currency pairs, one lot is 10 USD per PIP. However, for XAU, if employing PIP unit, one lot is 1 USD per PIP.  
This is not to say you cannot run Icarus on XAU. But you have to know the difference of symbols properties to set a proper settings.

OK an update on my test running ICarus on all 28 pairs simultaneously with a view to using it for prop firms, I have been running it on FTMO trial accounts.  
Settings (basic) were:  
Bollinger off  
Stoch on at 20/80  
RSI on at 20/80  
Initiate both cycle off.  
Grid multiplier D'Alembert  
Lot size multiplier Fibonacci.  
  
It generated very good profit with very low drawdown normally, however the week before last got caught in a couple of pairs when the JPY collapsed and last week/this week has got caught in 2 CAD pairs where the CAD has rocketed due to the price of oil increasing suddenly - both instances caused the 5% drawdown limit to be breached.  
  
I have set it running again in this latest test with Bollinger turned on, I initially turned it off as from testing the MT5 version of Icarus the Bollinger over ruled the other 2 indicators - but it then became evident that the MT5 code translation was flawed so I don't think this will be an issue with the original MT4.  
  
Couple of ideas for additions/amendments:  
a) Invert trigger - at the moment this seems to just do the opposite of the signal, so if it's activated instead of opening trades when the 20/80 bars are breached it will open trades when the price is within the 20-80 range.  
I think perhaps an alternative/addition would be to invert the direction of trade when in one-directional trade mode. So at the moment for instance when the 80% line is breached it opens a sell as it is expecting the price to bounce back below. How about an option to invert this so if the threshold line is breached it instead opens a trade in the same direction to trade with the momentum of the price?  
b) A chart based stoploss centered on the "P/L Sym" figure so if Icarus is running on multiple charts and one chart starts to get away past a user defined amount ($100 or so for example) then at a certain point the trades on the pair are closed as a safety measure and the loss is taken while allowing the other pairs to continue trading.

Found a significant bug in the ATR grid routine.  
  
It seems to stop increasing the grid past a certain price and then when the price hits that target each time the EA still opens a progressive lot size trade according to the lot size multiplier that is set. Had it happen twice overnight on CADCHF and also USDJPY when the price moved against the trade.  

Attached Image (click to enlarge)

[![Click to Enlarge

Name: photo_2022-01-20_07-06-08.jpg
Size: 87 KB](/attachment/image/4126592/thumbnail?d=1642662395)](/attachment/image/4126592?d=1642662395)   

Attached Image (click to enlarge)

[![Click to Enlarge

Name: photo_2022-01-20_07-06-13.jpg
Size: 85 KB](/attachment/image/4126593/thumbnail?d=1642662396)](/attachment/image/4126593?d=1642662396)   

You can see in the second list of trades above USDJPY grid price stopped increasing somewhere between 113.328-113.334 and in the attached chart below you can see all the additional positions that were opened as the price moved down and back up past the target price in the same 1M candle.  

Attached Image (click to enlarge)

[![Click to Enlarge

Name: IC.jpg
Size: 774 KB](/attachment/image/4126596/thumbnail?d=1642662655)](/attachment/image/4126596?d=1642662655)   

The USDJPY eventually went as far as a 197.0 lot trade (from an initial 0.20 lot start) before closing out in profit but this is an account blowing error and I'd advise the ATR grid option not be used until it is resolved. Of course this can be avoided by setting a limit on the number of positions the EA will open to about a max of 6 however but that comes with the risk that a trade will not close out in profit very quickly.

I encounter this also, try to have a larger period for your ATR. what happens with ATR with small period is that sometimes you are given a very small grid size for one cycle, this makes the trades too close to each other and would really risk a blown up account. That is my experience. So i always use a higher TF and a larger period, thismakes the grid contract and expand not too abruptly.   
  
I hope i helped.

> Found a significant bug in the ATR grid routine. It seems to stop increasing the grid past a certain price and then when the price hits that target each time the EA still opens a progressive lot size trade according to the lot size multiplier that is set. Had it happen twice overnight on CADCHF and also USDJPY when the price moved against the trade.
> 
> Ignored

ATR grid size is only using ATR to calculate a dynamic grid size when every new buy/sell cycle is initiated. When using ATR grid size, the Take Profit of the settings is also override a new Take Profit. When in the cycle (buy or sell) ATR grid size won't interfere any of the trading logic, such as gs_progression and progression.  
  
For a grid trading EA, grid size choosing is critical to profit or loss. In other words, you have to tuning the parameters of ATR for well to give you an suitable grid size for trading. ATR grid size is just replacing the fix grid size setting at the moment of any buy/sell cycle is initiated. However, since Icarus only have one variable for grid size, once a new grid size is calculated, the new grid size will be applied to all cycles even the grid size when determine at the moment of another cycle initiated is not equal to the new grid size, the new grid size will replace the old grid size.  
  
If want each cycle has its own grid size, we have to declare two grid size variables, one for buy cycle another for sell cycle. But to do this will change a lots of codes of Icarus, so, I intend not to do it. If someone is interested, he can modify the codes of Icarus as he like.  
  
As a conclusion, when employing more indicators in trading the trader has to have more knowledge of the indicators he use. For different symbols, different brokers, the appropriate setting of indicators is also different. NEVER NEVER ask others what his settings are, because your broker is not the same as his broker. You have to find out the optimal settings for your broker as well as the symbol you are trading by yourself.

No, it is totally irrelevant to the grid size progression. No mater what the grid size is determined, buy manual setting or by ATR, the grid size progression is base on the determined grid size to calculate the virtual SL. As attached source codes:  

Attached Image (click to enlarge)

the variable grid_size once determined, never changed within the whole cycle unless a new cycle is initiated, and this is the only place Icarus refers to the value of grid_size to calculate the virtual SL.  
Also, gs_progression is use in the CalculateVolume() function to calculate the volume of the last position, and use to calculate virtual SL as shown above.  
It is no reason that ATR_Grid_Size() will affect the grid size progression behavior of any form.

No, I did not code the EA to have a max size of grid. There is a setting of max_position that you can set, the default should be 6. Means only open at most 6 position in a cycle. (I did not code this part of Icarus, it remains the same as original Icarus).  
  
Atr_Grid_Size() only give you a dynamic grid size to Icarus, no more and no less. Many people have tested Icarus and also tested ATR function for several months. You are the first one to have such issue of ATR. Perhaps you can check the Journal to see whether or not there are error message. If you are running fore test, also check the Experts to see if there are error message.  
  
Also, as I have mentioned before, do not trust the default settings of any EA. If you understand those indicators you can tune them for good or you should not to use those indicators. The original Icarus is without any indicators to decide the moment to open a position and/or for helping to decide a grid size dynamically. In fact, a grid trading logic doesn't need indicators to trade. I have my own grid trading EAs, with the trend or against the trend, I didn't use any indicators. Before you use any indicator, I suggest you should run Icarus without applying any indicator first. Then, if you hope to have a better result, you can try to apply indicators one by one to see whether or not the result comes better.  
  
Even I use ATR for grid size, I also have to tune the settings of ATR symbol by symbol as well as broker by broker. For different symbols have their different price actions, also the optimal settings of ATR are different. Different brokers have different [spreads](/brokers/spreads "View Live Spreads on the Broker Guide") for symbols and they are affect the profit you can have in a trade, that is, the appropriate grid sizes are also a minor different.

Yes. Robin's hedging filter works for a given range of price, when the price is within the range will not do hedging. Because Robin has a separated cycle to manage hedging orders and the hedging order when reach its stop loss won't hedging the loss hedging order any more and just receive the SL. The hedging filter is use to prevent the hedging order hit its stop loss frequently when price is wandering between the price range. That is, prevent from hedging order SL and re-hedge another hedging order again and the new hedging order also hits its SL, and again,....

Hello all,  
I found a scenario and I think this scenario will lead us to lose a lot of money  
I will suggest a solution and I hope if we all think together to find a better approach  
  
——————————————————————————————————————————————  
  
Example  
Order 1 - Buy 0.01  
Order 2 - Buy 0.01  
Order 3 - Buy 0.02  
Order 4 - Buy 0.03  
Order 5 - Buy 0.05  
Order 6 - Buy 0.08  
Order 7 - Sell 0.08 -> Hedge order  
  
then the sell will close the first buy order on profit  
  
Order 2 - Buy 0.01  
Order 3 - Buy 0.02  
Order 4 - Buy 0.03  
Order 5 - Buy 0.05  
Order 6 - Buy 0.08  
  
——————————————————————————————————————————————  
  
I suddenly found the program opens 2 orders at the same time  
  
**_5 old orders_**  
Order 2 - Buy 0.01  
Order 3 - Buy 0.02  
Order 4 - Buy 0.03  
Order 5 - Buy 0.05  
Order 6 - Buy 0.08  
  
**_2 new orders_**  
Order 7 - Buy 0.08  
Order 8 - Sell 0.08  
  
Order 7 opened because we already under the next buy level  
and Order 8 opened because we have to hedge at this point  
  
but if we looked at this scenario we open 2 orders with the same lot and in different direction  
There are no meaning of opening 2 new trades at the same price in different direction   
  
——————————————————————————————————————————————  
  
I think one of the solution could be adding a new parameter to choose the number of opened orders we want to hedge  
so if we set this parameter with 2 for example  
  
The last scenario will be   
  
**_5 old orders_**  
Order 2 - Buy 0.01  
Order 3 - Buy 0.02  
Order 4 - Buy 0.03  
Order 5 - Buy 0.05  
Order 6 - Buy 0.08  
  
**_2 new orders_**  
Order 7 - Buy 0.08 -> **opened because we already below the new buy level**  
Order 8 - Sell 0.16 ->**The hedge order = the sum of the lots of the last 2 orders**  
  
so this hedge order now has a meaning and do its job  
  
——————————————————————————————————————————————  
  
I hope if all of you can say his own opinion about this idea, if it will fix this problem or not  
or if there is any better idea for sure we are trying to reach the optimal solution   
  
Thank you.

Yes its really awesome, If we can made some enhancement I will really appreciate it.  
  
Lets assume our grid size and progression = 3  
and we are in a buy cycle  
  
Order 1 - Buy 0.01  
Order 2 - Buy 0.01  
Order 3 - Buy 0.02  
Order 4 - Buy 0.03  
Order 5 - Buy 0.05  
Order 6 - Buy 0.08  
Order 7 - Sell 0.08  
  
If order 7 and order 1 closed on profit then we will continue with orders  
  
Order 2 - Buy 0.01  
Order 3 - Buy 0.02  
Order 4 - Buy 0.03  
Order 5 - Buy 0.05  
Order 6 - Buy 0.08  
  
We will not open another Hedge orders  
but we will check if the price now is less than or equal to the next buy level we will open another buy order  
  
  
Order 2 - Buy 0.01  
Order 3 - Buy 0.02  
Order 4 - Buy 0.03  
Order 5 - Buy 0.05  
Order 6 - Buy 0.08  
Order 7 - Buy 0.13  
  
If the price continues we will open a new hedge order  
  
Order 2 - Buy 0.01  
Order 3 - Buy 0.02  
Order 4 - Buy 0.03  
Order 5 - Buy 0.05  
Order 6 - Buy 0.08  
Order 7 - Buy 0.13  
Order 8 - Sell 0.13  
  
and so on ..  
If the price go up again we will close all the order when they reach the TP  
because the Buy lots are greater than the sell lots  
so we can close it on profit  
  
and If we can add the number of hedge orders as an attribute it will be a huge advantage for example  
  
Order 1 - Buy 0.01  
Order 2 - Buy 0.01  
Order 3 - Buy 0.02  
Order 4 - Buy 0.03  
Order 5 - Buy 0.05  
Order 6 - Buy 0.08  
  
if the attribute = 2  
then   
  
Order 1 - Buy 0.01  
Order 2 - Buy 0.01  
Order 3 - Buy 0.02  
Order 4 - Buy 0.03  
Order 5 - Buy 0.05  
Order 6 - Buy 0.08  
Order 7 - Sell 0.13  
  
Thank you in advance, I really appreciate your contribution.

No trade should be done without protection. It could be SL for individual trade or Equity Loss.  
I have practised hedging to protect vis a vis using SL for more than 10 years and my experience says only those with deep pockets can succeed.  
I have the mentality of selling naked options, so I am OK with this kind of approach. The market-making business model is to flush out weaker hands.  
  
From what Investopedia says, I have used Range Trading quite profitably. I have no experience with trend grid trading.

  1. Grid trading involves placing buy and sell orders at set intervals around a set price.
  2. The grid can be created to profit from trends or ranges.
  3. To profit from trends, place buy orders at intervals above the set price, and sell orders below the set price.
  4. To profit from ranges, place buy orders at intervals below the set price, and sell orders above the set price.

I wish you all the best for your efforts to tame Hedging for short-term automated trading. 

Practice makes a person perfect

Yes, we're only taking H1 pullbacks into the greater W1 trend. Please stop hedging, I've burnt a lot of money learning it. The big boys know where to push a chart, and this happens only in longer timeframes, even above the daily in my opinion.  
  
If we want to go long, the shorts are to be disabled like in my templates, and vice versa for short, the longs are.  
  
The ATR grid range calculation is set to 0.3 thus it shouldn't be too agressive. Watch red news though.  
  
I know that the entries based on stoch could be a tad better. But I found this setting a good compromise between performance and dd.

Hello, I want to say thank you for sharing the EA. I think it's a robust EA better then most on the market and it has a lot of potential. I've now been using an hedging EA for 3 years, it's connected to an neural network do do a little risk management and works like a charm. DD's can be huge but it never blew up an account as long as you have followed the risk guidelines.  
  
I've been testing Icarus the last days a lot and I would like to suggest and try out a few ideas, see how they would go.  
  
The first suggestion I'd like to make is the position sizing or position progression that the hedging EA that I use works with.  
It starts with a statical order progression for the first three orders and then it continues the progression with a geometrical raise, now after reaching a certain number of orders when it wants to add a new order to the grid, it closes the first order of the cycle to then continue the grid further.  
  
It would look something like this;  
  
order 1. - 0.01 lot  
order 2. - 0.01 lot  
order 3. - 0.01 lot  
  
order 4. - 0.03 lot  
order 5. - 0.06 lot  
order 6. - 0.09 lot  
order 7. - 0.12 lot  
order 8. - 0.15 lot  
  
order 9. - 0.21 lot  
  
As you see it starts statical and then adds per 0.03 position from order 4 to 8 and then at 9 it added 0.06 on the position and that's the furthest I've experienced it go. Now depending on the equity left of the account it will close the first position for a loss to be able to add a new position to keep the grid going and that way it should be able to go for a long time and keep a low realized loss of less then 3 or 5 % because the first positions are small.  
  
**

Yeah, that actually might be it and then they start closing the first order with a loss when they start opening the first order of the 3rd group which adds 0.06 each time and this way they offset the losses for more profits on the last lots and are able to keep the TP very close.  
  
for example;  
  
order 1. - 0.01 lot  
order 2. - 0.01 lot  
order 3. - 0.01 lot  
  
order 4. - 0.03 lot -> start 0.03  
order 5. - 0.06 lot -> +0.03  
order 6. - 0.09 lot -> +0.03  
order 7. - 0.12 lot -> +0.03  
order 8. - 0.15 lot -> +0.03  
  
order 9. - 0.21 lot -> close order 1 then start +0.06 group  
  
There might be a few additions to this like, when they open order 10 which adds 0.06 they'll close order 2 and 3 together to continue.  
Hope this can be useful, I think if you can continue the grid for like forever with only taking small losses and the profits making up for when the cycle ends then you'll have something powerful.  
  
Oh and maybe you could add some feature to stop trading after x amount of daily profit.

I am not so sure. You can test it on the fore test.  
I think it is a better way to code a special purpose EA for protecting Icarus by hedging. The EA is not a grid trading EA, it has its own magic number, but can input the magic number of Icarus. Then the EA can monitor the performance of Icarus and decide when to put hedging orders (with its magic number) to prevent Icarus from a huge DD. The EA should also manage two hedging cycles, hedging buys and hedging sells, each orders in the cycle are corresponding to the specific orders they are hedging against. I think to code such an EA is more easily than to add hedging function into Icarus.

This thread is a great read. Just a few general thoughts I had on developing a grid EA that might be useful:   
  
1\. Hedging is < some logic that ensures that new **long** trades are always **above** prior long trades and new **short** trades are always **below** prior short trades and that **newer** trades are at **higher** volumes (either greater in number or size). Price always moves somewhere eventually and if you follow this logic eventually your last trade will allow all the underwater trades to resolve, as long as your account doesn't blow up.   
2\. It doesn't matter how effectively coded your EA is if you overtrade in relation to your margin/account size it will blow up. You'll make more money in the long run by not blowing up.  
3\. **The real holy grail isn't an EA** , it's people like @TeChaoLiang who share their knowledge, and code freely. I hope some day I can be as useful. His idea about a 'monitor/overseer' EA is very good.   
  
Good luck, gridders!

Hello.   
I would appreciate this too. some thoughts why:  
  
a) all the indicators make the EA really complex and quite difficult to use, also the chance to fall into a "curve fitting mode" is very high, if you know what I mean.  
I still use the original version with the hot buttons* (I follow the signals of the market and my stomach ![](https://resources.faireconomy.media/images/emojis/64/1f609.png?v=15.1) )  
  
b) automated hedging is very dangerous in my eyes, at least for those with not so big pockets  
Maybe I am wrong, but with the basic idea which that indicator provides, it becomes a bit safer.  
  
*perhaps useful for some:  
if you set the equity warning in the EA to a very small value, the hotbuttons will turn yellow and you will see more support lines. Then you can see exactly where the respective take profit moves when you trigger an order via the yellow buttons. In addition with a good idea where the market could go, I have recently mastered some difficult situations.

If the Compound Ratio Moving Average (CoRa_Wave) were to be integrated into Icarus, I believe it would need to be traded "with the trend" as it would average into pullbacks in the main trend, which should keep Icarus quite safe. The precision of CoRa_Wave would not allow Icarus to get caught in a massive move against the trend.  
  
Most probably, I would partner Icarus with a CoRa_Wave EA so that we could ride the trend with CoRa-Wave while Icarus cleans up the pullbacks.  
  
Umberleigh
